description:
This shop really pays attention to the little things - and they matter! A lot! 
First of all, this is the first place I've been to that actually foams the milk in its iced lattes! A definite plus for me. Also, the ice cubes in my latte were made from coffee so it doesn't get diluted when the cubes melt. 

The latte itself was quite strong surprisingly (since my lattes usually aren't) and good flavor. Definitely check this cute place out if you're in the Mission District!
author: Rebecca Z.

description:
Love, Love, Love Coffee Shop. Best coffee in the city, and I've sampled them all. The space is cozy and the attention to detail from this local owner is always welcoming, tasty and lifts my spirits. 

I like the Brazil beans (with the well designed label and fun name - J Church) but I try others, too.
author: Meghan S.

description:
great spot to get your day started
I had a few hours before work and needed to get some work done, found this place and I'm glad I did it was very homie, quite and makes great coffee

I had a latte with some delicious chocolate chip cookie (recomendeddddddd) lol
author: Anne C.

description: Love this place. The coffee is so strong and smells amazing. Literally makes me excited how good the coffee smells while I drive. Usually get an iced americano w coffee ice cubes.. mocha is also a go to.
author: Diana L.

description:
The challenge I was given was: Find a top 5 coffee place in all of San Francisco. After a lot of research, I hit upon this gem, in the mission.

Ironically, we had passed this tiny, shoe-box sized, family owned place, several times - it is easy to miss. 

Once you are inside, your are greeted with the aromas of cawfee, and baked goods. They have an excellent selection of baked goods, including, vegan, dairy-free, gluten-free options form donuts to date rolls to many other coffee accouterments.

This is a pour-over coffee paradise. Be prepared for the owner to recommend the right coffee (he tunes into you), by specifying if you are light, dark or medium roast person. I picked dark, and he recommended an excellent crop from Brazil. My friend picked medium, and he recommended Ethiopia. She knows her coffee, and as a SF native, she felt this was right at the top.

They also have almond, half and half and many types of milk choices, as well as the less adventurous lattes, mochas, teas, espressos. 

The owner said their secret sauce is customer service - and we experienced the warmth and genuine passion of a master barista, who hand picks the shop's blends.
author: Sam K.

description:
The reviews were so amazing, I have had this bookmarked for a while. We drove to the mission on a Sunday around 11am. We ordered the much hyped cinnamon toast (with honey).

It was ok, not enough butter, nothing at all special. I was also grossed out a little by the gal who licked her finger right after she served us. (how many times does she lick her fingers and how many times does she was them?
author: Amy W.

description:
What a gem!!! 

Quaint little shop with coffee ice cubes. The iced beverages are served in hot cups. Unique :) 

The owner(?)/ barista gave me a run down on what kind of coffee it was that I was about to drink. 

You can tell it's a local favorite, seemed like he knew the customers by name!
author: Sandra D.

description:
COFFEE ICE CUBES.

I love cold brew but I'm a slow drinker so that leaves me with watered down cold brew almost every time I get one.

BUT not at CoffeeShop! I was seriously blown away by the coffee ice cubes because that just shows me they try and care about their coffee. On top of that, the coffee was delicious. 

It's a small shop and they sell a variety of drinks and pastries. They've got some interesting concoctions but I normally just go for the simple drinks so you'd have to try that for yourself.

Service was great! The staff was friendly and quick. Overall great place to stop by for coffee!
author: Jennifer H.

description: This place is just fine. Nothing special at all. Menu is confusing and crooked. Cold brew honestly tastes like water. Prices are very expensive and food is small. Maybe we ordered the wrong thing but I don't get the hype.
author: Hannah W.

description: Good drip coffee. Love the amazeballs. Owner is really enthusiastic and a hard worker! Him and his wife make the food and it tastes great.
author: Brooke C.

description:
THE bestest chai lattes in all the land!

Small little shop where we usually grab two chais and some delicious cookies to go whenever we're in the area running errands. Love the laid back vibe and super nice folks that work here. Think I have about four of those pink pins with the face on it.

You'll know what I mean if you come through.
author: Joanna R.

description: Small but mighty!  This place is IT. Coffee-pour over or not(because there are days that I don't have patience for pour over).  Many seriously insanely good gluten free options that are seriously insanely good even if you happen to love gluten. And the savory muffin that is a breakfast in itself?do it. Just do it. Where's the extra stars for super nice baristas?  Can't believe I drive right by for so long.
author: S Blair P.

description: New to the neighborhood and stumbled across CoffeeShop! So thrilled I did. Haven't found oat milk anywhere else in the city yet. Had a fantastic iced latte with the famous coffee cubes and this "devil inside" breakfast muffin/quiche hybrid. What a treat!
author: Shaina J.

description:
Holy shit I haven't had this good of service in a long while. And the coffee was the best I've had in San Francisco- so much better than Blue Bottle and Philz and what it. And the coffee was CHEAP too- around $3 for a double shot of espresso and a little more for a large freshly ground coffee- everything is brewed to order. The owners apparently handmade all of the pastries and breads and cookies and things.

I wish I had gotten the name of the barista because she was awesome. Super welcoming, provided excellent recommendations, and pulled fantastic shots of espresso and brewed great coffee. I was going to get one of their food items and she said it was on the house due to it being my first visit. They have several different roasts of coffee and espresso. They use Ubuntu beans which I loved and as a bonus, it was all fair trade and organic. 

I truly loved everything about this spot. It is tiny and there are just 3 tables outside, though they do have wifi and if you're there on a nice day, it would be good to enjoy your coffee outside. Fantastic coffee, excellent prices, amazing service- I'd give this place more stars if I could. My only wish is that it wasn't on the other side of town of me. Even with the distance, I would come here which is saying a lot given the number of coffee shops in San Francisco. Easily 5 stars.
author: Seema U.

description:
We were really looking forward to trying CoffeeShop.  Yelpers love the coffee, service, and the space (considering how small the place is).  Man was I let down...maybe we came in on an off day. 

Sunday afternoon and the space was the best part.  The only good thing about the iced coffee was the coffee ice cubes.  Great idea...but the coffee tasted a bit off.  I usually drink my coffee black and will add sugar and/or cream to save it.  This one needed saving.

The mocha was good.  Nice chocolate flavor without being overly sweet.

Service was... there.  After walking in, I couldn't help but feel like we were disturbing the barista.  Anyway, she got us what we asked for.  I'll try them again, but after going to the other cafes down the street.
author: Zoran L.

description: The coffee is delicious. It has a distinct flavor that you can't find elsewhere. The ambiance is very laid back and comfortable. Plenty of books and games to keep yourself entertained if needed and the peanut butter cookie bar is the PERFECT treat when you just need something to treat your sweet tooth.. I would recommend this place to anyone! The staff is also very kind and prompt.
author: Hayle C.

description:
Stopped by for iced coffee (super strong, for those who like it that way) and realized why coffee cubes (ice cubes made out of coffee) should probably not be a thing. Unless they're made with filtered water, in a freezer with nothing that has an odor, and used almost immediately, they're going to have a weird aftertaste.  I can't tell you which of those things are true in this case, but at least one of them seemed to be.  (Mission Pie also uses coffee cubes, and I'm hoping it's a trend that will eventually go extinct.)

Will plan on stopping by some other time and checking out the hot coffee, which smelled/appeared delicious.
author: Joe B.

description:
Similar to a lot of reviews I was very much convinced to try this place, and I'm happy to say I walked away a very happy person! It's definitely a more grab-and-go type of place so don't expect to stay there and work. On nice days they do set out some tables and chairs on the sidewalk but their location isn't in the best spot so there's not much to look at on this part of mission st.

I ordered the Thai Breakfast and it was delicious! I added a bit of simple syrup and that really helped bring out the sweetness of the banana. It tastes a bit like a banana coffee milk shake but less creamy and thick. I think next time I'll ask to sub half and half with almond milk and ice cubes with their coffee ice cubes :)

I also ordered the blueberry muffin and it was scrumptious! It was super moist and sponge-y. The blueberries on the inside were aplenty. And the small sugar glaze on top added the perfect touch.

The service was also very friendly and I didn't feel at all weird asking about all the different drinks. 10/10 will come back!
author: Angelina H.

description:
I'm so confused how this place has such an amazing rating. I'm 90% sure that I just went on a really off day, but I'm not sure I'd be back to give it another chance.

My boyfriend and I were really excited to try the coffee here when we saw the high rating, as we regularly try coffee from all kinds of different coffee shops. It was an unusually warm day for SF, so we both opted for a cold brew. 

When I saw the barista putting ice into the cup, I noticed that the ice cubes were frozen coffee, which I actually really appreciated. It even made me more excited to try it! But after he poured the cold brew and I took a sip...God, it was awful. I think I've had better iced coffee from Starbucks. 

That particular batch must've been made terribly, because it was not at all what cold brew should taste like. Instead of having a smooth and mellow taste, it tasted like bitter dirt. And speaking of dirt, I actually could feel coffee grounds in my mouth, so dirt is exactly what I felt like I was drinking. 

Two stars instead of one because the barista was friendly...but I had to throw away the coffee. Which I don't think I've ever done in my life. Based on my experience alone, I would not recommend the cold brew. Maybe their other drinks are better...I'd really hope so.
author: Sara L.

description: I'm happy I discovered this place, because it's truly awesome. I went there for a short coffee break on a busy day and I didn't regret it. I had a delicious chai latte and a piece of apple banana bread which was very good as well. The guy at the counter was nice and made me smile. Overall a great experience to lighten up your day.
author: Oleg K.

description: Definitely a rockstar coffee shop by Wilson!  Must check it out!  Black Diamond is the bomb!!!
author: Joseph L.

description:
One of the best coffee shops I've ever been to... and I've been to a lot! 

This is not one of those "come with your MacBook and sit down for hours" pretentious coffee shops. It's more like a hole in the wall where the barista was ridiculously friendly and everything was made to perfection, including the little treats we bought and the blueberry muffin that she toasted and buttered for me .

I highly recommend this place !
author: Jasmine S.

description: A cute, little spot run by a guy who is enthused by what he does and giving people a quality product. Truly enjoyed my "amazeball" and bulletproof coffee (they had another name for it: it contains grass fed butter and coconut oil). I look forward to coming back. Three cheers to the CoffeeShop!
author: Curt W.

description:
Hmm... expecting better quality... maybe because it was later in the day?

While visiting San Fran, my mom and I tried out several coffee shops, including this one because of its fantastic ratings! When we got there we accidentally walked into to weed shop next door... whoops. When we switched over to our true destination, the barista told us she often gets their customers accidentally wandering into the coffee shop as well. Do I see a collaboration in our near future? Who knows, maybe weed coffee will be the next big thing! 

I had never tried matcha before, so I got the matcha latte with almond milk. My mom, not a coffee drinker, just got the hot chocolate. The shop was empty and we sat outside with our drinks.

The matcha latte was pretty good, I guess. Not as strong as I would have liked, maybe I should just get the regular tea next time. And my mom's hot chocolate had an interesting flavor. It was taste of Ghirardelli chocolate, but with a dry and powdery aftertaste...

Overall, I thought it was overpriced for the quality we received. Oh well.
author: Shayne C.

description:
Look for the green building. 

Bulletproof Coffee goes by the name of "Sherpa" here. I make this every morning at home and was ecstatic to see it being produced at this spot. The staff is friendly and "chill" by definition. Don't come up here all in a rush demanding shit. It kills the vibe. 

I also tried their toast which was an inch-thick piece of heaven with peanut butter, honey and cinnamon. 

If you're thinking twice. Do it. Do it now.
author: Christopher S.

description: Amazing coffee and toast! Must try the Thai banana cream coffee which the owner treated me to :) I  Even got their new cleaning product. Can't wait to try it. Will definitely be back for another coffee fix! TY!
author: Francis Elena S.

description: Another Gem in Bernal Heights. Grab a @Bird in the morning and scoot on over to the CoffeeShop. Try a light roast pour over black or an almond latte along with a vegan oatmeal ball for a light breakfast. #da
author: Brian C.

description:
Where do I begin? Somehow this teeny coffee shop has the most delicious coffee, baked goods, and service. 

In an attempt to make up for my missed pilates class I figured I would try out this spot to salvage my morning. I opted for the iced coffee (loved the coffee ice cubes!) and the honey/peanut butter/cinnamon toast.

THE TOAST. This was no joke. Nested on a lightly crisped thick piece of toast was melted butter, crunchy peanut butter, and a ton of cinnamon. The barista was nice to enough to bring it out for me and go back to package it up 'to go' when he realized I was walking out. Talk about a guy who understands women. 

My coffee vocab isn't too advanced, but I will say the iced coffee 1) tasted delish and 2) woke me up. The barista even put cream in it for me! v cute.

Great little spot! How can you not give this place five stars?
author: Nicole W.

description:
The praise heaped upon this one-man operation was mind-boggling enough for my curiosity to get piqued. On a rare free weekday morning, I decided to alleviate my piqued state and take a long ride on the 14 to that neighborhood south of Cesar Chavez where you find that urban enclave of taquerias and hipster hangouts like Emmy's Spaghetti Shack and Baby Blues BBQ. I think I walked by CoffeeShop at least twice before realizing it was the bright green space with the glass door (photo:  ). At first, I was delighted there was only one customer ahead of me, but that situation changed quickly as regulars started trickling in at an alarming pace.

Luckily I had the wherewithal to get my order in quickly and decided on the $4.75 Mocha which the barista made lightning quick in preparation of the incoming crowd. It was a satisfying concoction with a swirl of chocolate syrup on a billowy spritz of whipped cream (photo: http://bit.ly/1V3WYrE). But then after reading Ruggy's review, I realize now that I should have given the $5 Sherpa Coffee a try with such unusual ingredients as Kerrygold butter and coconut oil blended into the coffee. Maybe next time. In the meantime, I also ordered a $4 Latke with raisin-freckled applesauce and whipped cream just to nibble on as I sat outside at one of the two cafe tables.

This is when the barista was working like a highly organized madman accommodating multiple orders, so much so that I thought for sure my order fell into an abyss. I was about to give up and leave, but I gave it the old college try by swimming upstream through the waiting crowd and reminding him of my latke order. Since more than twenty minutes elapsed, he felt terrible about his oversight and gave me a complementary peanut butter cookie for my patience. Oh and the latke, too (photo: http://bit.ly/1WiNIyn), which ended up being on the lukewarm side for all his trouble. Completely forgivable although he definitely could use help back there during the peak hours.

FOOD/DRINK - 4 stars...a stellar mocha but a lukewarm latke after a lengthy wait
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...cute, compact spot but it does get claustrophobic with little effort
SERVICE - 4 stars...I still give the barista credit for juggling so many orders
TOTAL - 4 stars...such a generic name for a unique spot
author: Ed U.

description: Finally, iced coffee complete with coffee ice cubes!
author: Ash R.

description:
So, the coffee is definitely delicious but on my first visit, I felt the service was a bit sub-par.  I love coffee and I've been meaning to check out CoffeeShop for a while to try their unique iced lattes that actually have microfoam and coffee ice cubes and to try the cold brew coffee that is also served with coffee ice cubes.  I love that the coffee won't be diluted as the ice melts.  Their coffee has a smooth, nutty flavor to it (not overly acidic like a lot of other coffee shops around).  So, I checked out on Yelp and it said they were open until 6 PM, so we hopped over around 5:40 PM hoping to get in before they closed.

I ordered an iced latte and an iced coffee and was disappointed when the barista put regular ice cubes rather than the coffee ice cubes I had been reading about in my drink!  When I later asked about it, he said that they had completely run out because of the hot weather and they had sold 768 iced coffees during the day and that they were actually "closed".  The last statement was rather confusing to me because their hours are clearly listed until 6 PM and the door was wide open, which indicated to me that they were still open for business.  Now, I completely understand that they would have run out of coffee ice cubes because it's impossible to be able to predict how many they would sell in a day and it's clear that their freezer/fridge can only hold so many ice cube trays!  However, I wish that he would have warned me when I ordered the drink that they were out of coffee ice cubes and would have to substitute with regular...that would have definitely changed my order.  To offer a non-perfect cup without warning me, or offering maybe a discount,  seemed inconsistent in product delivery.

Anyway, the coffee was definitely delicious and I was super impressed with the cold microfoam in the latte.  It's definitely a very special iced latte.  However, if I return, I will definitely come early in the day to get the full experience!
author: Jess Y.

description:
Coffee- My favorite iced coffee!! Soo good, and even better with coffee ice cubes. Sooo brilliant. Why don't every cafe do this?! I also had their Sherpa coffee which is coffee + butter + coconut oil and it is divine... Tasted like a very light liquids coconut candy but I recommend slow sipping and the smallest size bc it is quite rich. 

Ambiance/Location- exterior is bright lime green and I didn't see an obvious sign that says store name. Smells really good! Small, cozy shop by a muni bus stop with a few small tables and chairs outside. Menu is on a monitor and there are a lot of pastries available as well.

Service- one female staff present when I went on Saturday afternoon. She was friendly and took our orders correctly. Pleasant interaction/experience.

Overall, love this place already even though I haven't tried any of their pastries yet. If I lived close by, I would want to come here often! Mattered parking on the street available and free street parking a couple blocks away but finding free parking could be challenging. Takes credit card.
author: Iris H.

description:
Small coffee shop w outside seating. They have a good variety of coffee & it's a plus that they freeze coffee ice cubes for their iced coffee/iced drinks.  Though it was $5 for a large iced coffee, it was cool to eat the ice cubes after finishing my coffee to finish off with even more coffee!  Def a must try to coffee luverz. 

The only downside for me is the horrific flashbacks from seeing the nightclub Roccapulco across the street HAHA.
author: Tiffany Z.

description:
This is a place that takes extreme care and pride in its craft. My boyfriend loves the mission 16 (coffee with a splash of warm milk) and the quality is comparable to Italy/Europe. He thinks that this is the best coffee in the entire US. They take extreme care where the filters are rinsed with hot water to wash away any chemical residue on the filter that may have altered the taste slightly. The owner is friendly and awesome - so lucky to have an amazing local spot nearby!

I also tried the sherpa (coffee with kerrigold butter and coconut oil) - super healthy but very rich. I would only recommend the 8oz version to start. One would not be hungry after drinking this for breakfast!

More of a to-go place rather a place to loiter and gather.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Me: Hello Sir, what's the strongest coffee you have
Barista: I recommend the cold brew
Me: I'll take it!

Although the coffee was good, I'm looking for coffee that gives me the jitters.  This did not give me jitters.  On to the next.

Friendly staff.
author: Linda N.

description: Amazing coffee and great chai lattes. They have a little shop that offers bite size energy balls made out of cocoa, oatmeal and flax seeds. I must try is the dare devil muffin that has a whole boiled egg inside! Yummy!
author: wanda u.

description: I live in the neighborhood and used to run down here most weekends. Recently, though, my cappuccinos and mochas have been kind of bland- I think maybe the new folks they hired don't know the recipes/procedures as well as the owners? Not sure what's going on, but I've migrated to coffee spots in the mission in the meantime.
author: Jean L.

description: My last day in bay area and I decided to do some work in some calm place where nobody can disturb me. Usually it's a coffeeshop and that's what I found. This place is exactly what I was looking for. Great variety of flavors and fast service. I spent here almost 2 hours and could accomplish what I needed to be done.
author: Nade T.

description: Our first time at Coffee shop and it's a hit. Great pour over, Cortada and vegan bites! Yum!
author: Curtis E.

description:
Friendly baristas and and my fav -- dirty matcha / shot of espresso, with coffee ice cubes.

They make a mean sherpa coffee too.

One minor point: the pricing seems arbitrary -- as in, sometimes I'll order the same thing and get charged a different price depending on the person. Or it won't be the same on the board as in the checkout system. It's a small business but just wanted to make a note of it.
author: Victoria C.

description: Great coffee, sustainable beans.  Have a Sherpa coffee that is fantastic, since we were looking for our morning bullet coffee.  Would definitely recommend and will be back.
author: Neil B.

description:
loved this place so much! wilson, thank you for the great conversation and excellent iced coffee. it truly was delicious, i appreciate the recommendation. also, loved the dirty chai and the gluten free/dairy free chocolate donut. will definitely be back next time i'm in town! also, did a little write up about the shop for my website.

https://www.namaskyoga.com/blog/2018/3/12/coffeeshop-a-san-fran-gem
author: Michaela M.

description: Been a loyal and neighbor customer since the beginning. Laid back and friendly; stopping by the CoffeeShop has become my morning ritual!
author: Jason G.

description: Very good coffee joint. The lady who served us coffee was very friendly and professional. The coffee beans smell amazing! :)
author: Angie W.

description: This little coffee is so wonderful! We're from the east coast so having a locally owned coffee shop at every corner is foreign to us but this one stands out. The kind man who helped us prepared our drinks right in front of us and asked us to taste our drinks before we paid for them! We'll definitely come back next time we visit the Bay Area. And my friend said it's the best Americano he's had, and trust me, he's had many Americanos.
author: Diana T.

description: Very delicious coffee in a stylish but unpretentious, friendly place.
author: Makayla G.

description: The iced latte with the coffee ice cubes is so good that I even get it when it's cold! And I'm typically a default hot drink person!
author: Adi F.

description:
I want to like this tiny coffee bar, I really do. But several times now, when I come in the afternoon, two different guys do some pretty poor customer service. 

One time, an employee walked in, looked right past me, and started talking to the person behind me without even asking if I have been helped. I was the obvious next person in line, but he just looked right past me. It was strange as well as insulting. Like I'm not standing there? I'm almost 6' tall. So.... not sure what that was about.

The other employee won't make eye contact or in any way acknowledge the next customer until he is finished with the previous customer. I'm sorry, but being a barista means doing about 53 things at once. That's just the job. 

I have also witnessed this same barista be unable to give change for a twenty. (Not to me, but to the customer in line in front of me.)

I was a barista off and on for a little over 20 years. I know neither of you have any idea because of the way you treat me as a whole, but also because one of you gave me a giant latte the other day when I asked for a short.  I didn't mention it because I'm not into making things awkward, or wasting food. 

The few points I would like to make before I go:

All customers should be treated THE EXACT SAME WAY when they walk in. 

An employee should NEVER show more attention to a regular-or any person you know-than you do to a stranger. It is rude. 

An employee should be able to do math. Everybody should. An employee should be able to count a customer's change back to them. Your drawer will NEVER be off. Plus, people will KNOW you know what you are doing.  

(ie: if I pay $4.20 to you by way of a $20, you should say: .80 makes 5, $5 makes 10, $10 makes 20, and you should give me $$15.80 back.  Don't just hand me $15.80 and say here's $15.80, because it might not be. But if you count it back, you will know it is.
author: D M.

description: The coffee selection is amazing! It's as if they bring the world to you through the various varieties. They offer a selection of vegan pastries, which are good, but I do prefer the regular pastries. A huge plus is that the place is cute & tidy! I'll be back soon!
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description:
We stumbled across this little coffee shop while looking for bulletproof style coffee in the city.  The Sherpa is their version of bulletproof coffee, complete with copious amounts of Kerrygold butter and MCT oil and it did not disappoint.  In fact, it was so good that we return here each morning for another round.  Ardin is an incredible barista, very friendly and really added value to our experience!  

P.S. The pumpkin bread (with butter) is AMAZING!
author: Agusteanna B.

description:
Like having coffee in Harry Potter's cupboard beneath the stairs.

Came here specifically for their "Sherpa" which is coffee and butter blended together.

Tastes a bit like a very rich latte.

Tastes even better with honey added.

Be prepared for a wait since there's only one woman doing all the work.

My wait time was a little over 15 minutes when there were 3 people ahead if me who ordered espresso drinks.
author: Jack R.

description:
This small shop has some of the best coffee I have tried and Wilson is really, really good at making coffee and obviously cares a lot (in addition to just being a very cool guy to talk with).

The cold brew coffee is some of the best I have tried.  It is brewed for 2 days and the ice cubes it is served with are made of cold brew coffee themselves, so as to not dilute the drink.
I also tried the 'Thai Breakfast' drink with a blended banana and it is great as well.

I am really happy I found this place!
author: Rascal M.

description:
I had the best iced latte here today! All coffee shops should have coffee ice cubes. Just saying. 

CoffeeShop is located in a super small spot in Bernal Heights / outskirts of the Mission. Decided to check it out while I was in the area and I'm so glad I did - def one of my favorite coffee shops in SF now! I want to come back and try the Sherpa or dirty matcha latte! This is the only place I've been to that makes pour over matcha. Legit.

Don't bring your laptop expecting to do work - no room for anything except for coffee here. I kind of wish they did have a few tables though almost as much as I wish this place was closer to where I live!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
THIS PLACE IS SO COOL!

Don't know why it took so long for me to check it out, but I'm glad I finally did. 

I heard about this place through Thrillist.com and really sticks out with it's green exterior. It's tiny, and semi cluttered, but it possesses some sort of charm that I can't describe. There's a cool little black board nook that people decorate, along with a very unique LED muni schedule on the wall to the left of the entrance. Their pastry selection is pretty good as well.

If you want to try a cafe that most people don't seem to talk about in the Mission, CoffeeShop is definitely a good option.
author: Aaron C.

description:
3.5 STARS

Coffee Shop is a cute hole in the wall modern coffee shop in Bernal. There are some parking meters out front and free side street parking, but I personally find this place inconvenient to get to since I have to drive. They have a pretty impressively curated menu, including a variety of gluten free pastries, and it was not bad but I personally was not a huge fan of any of the food or drinks I ordered. 

LARGE MATCHA LATTE ($4.50) - 4 STARS:
Slightly sweet with the option for unsweetened Califia Almond Milk (+$1) in medium or large. It was good but I think I would stick to their Ubuntu espresso drinks. 

* ICED COFFEE - 3.5 STARS
With coffee cubes! a nice cold brew but prefer a hot drink

* TOAST ($3) - 3.5 STARS:
Brioche like fresh cut toast topped with your choice of butter, cinnamon, honey, peanut butter or a combination of which. I ordered it with the crunchy peanut butter and it was good but not mind blowing. I'm also not a big fan of the brioche like consistency - I prefer a more chewy, bread-like texture.
author: Jess C.

description:
Wilson runs the best hole-in-the-wall coffee shop in San Francisco.  The coffee and espresso-based drinks are par excellence.  The iced coffee has coffee ice-cubes.  The comestibles are fresh and delicious.

I also buy beans for home here, as they are consistently as good as Four Barrel and Ritual's--and better than Blue Bottle's often over-roasted choices.  They're typically sourced from farmer-owned cooperatives as well.

Finally, the staff are laid back and don't give hipster barista attitude.

It's a joy to have CoffeeShop in the neighborhood.  I wish Wilson would build 20 more around the city.
author: Badunc D.

description: Good place for a great coffee, cookies and pies. Potato and mushroom pie is my personal favorite. They have an honesty box if you don't have time to wait so you can just pour yourself some coffee and pay to the box. I personally love it.
author: Mark K.

description: The Bulletproof (Sherpa) coffee is legitimately the best kind I've had yet. So smooth. Perfect flavors. Got the toast w/ peanut butter & cinnamon & honey, so so good! Love this place, can't wait to come back.
author: Aryan R.

description: Their Cinnamon toast was amazing! The owner (Wilson) was gracious and very hospitable. Gotta come back here with my kiddos.
author: Jovi W.

description:
I have admired this small joint for a while now. From their decorated wooden panels that reads the time, to how impressive it is to pack all one can in the small proximity of a place. The owner mentioned it had been open for a couple of years but CoffeeShop started getting their fame more recently and I can see why.

The iced cold brew with coffee ice cubes is definitely their MVP. The cold brew tastes as if the grounds were happily bathing in the coffee for over 24 hours. The coffee ice cubes kept the coffee cool without "watering" it down. It had a really smooth and robust taste. And it kept me jittery for the entire day! There's nothing better than affordable, delicious coffee that will keep one caffeinated all day!
author: Linda K.

description: Finding this place was a bit confusing. On the top of three store front is says cookie co or lookie lo not sure which one hahaba. It's a tiny hole in the wall with an awesome, experienced barista. Nothing super fancy just great quality coffee. Ordered the dirty matcha. I should have gotten it sweeter, as I tend to like it sweeter. It was great though!
author: Asma w.

description:
Thursday, 7:00 AM.

Quickie:
+ Drink/Food quality
+ Service
- Hygiene
- Weak wi-fi signal
+ Atmosphere
+ Turnaround
* Menu variety
* Layout (small shop)

And then...?
CoffeeShop has bold drinks + appetizing snacks. What are you waiting for?

**********
Constructive comment:
*Source ingredients
author: Chuck N.

description: The best, amazing coffe place. This place to get some high-quality coffee with true love made into it. They ice their coffee with frozen coffee cubes. How can that be beat?
author: Tucker A.

description:
CoffeeShop was our first stop on our 2016 SF Cafe Adventures! The small shop was conveniently located on Mission St. in front of many Muni and shuttle stops. It had a very rustic and earthy ambience(my fave) and served a huge variety of coffees and fresh gluten and dairy free treats. We both enjoyed lattes with almond milk, a gluten/dairy free blueberry donut and a cacao powerball. As service typically contributes to your eating experience as much as the food does, I must say the service here was great! A smiling and energetic barista at 7am made my morning cup of coffee twice as satisfying.

Definitely coming back to try their Sherpa!
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Over 100 five star reviews can't be wrong!

I'm a sucker for Bulletproof Coffee. Being that I'm usually on work travel when visiting SF, I can't easily store things in a hotel refrigerator (butter, specifically). That means I have to rely on a savvy coffee shop that's bought into the benefits of adding butter + coconut oil to the morning cup of Joe for an extreme jolt of mental clarity. That coffee shop is, well, CoffeeShop.

Here they call it Sherpa Coffee. For the uninitiated, the creator of Bulletproof Coffee (Dave Asprey) experienced a tea version using yak butter when trekking through Tibet with a group of sherpas. They drink yak butter tea to give them the mental fortitude and energy levels to mount a giant edifice in extreme weather conditions. If it works for these Nepalese adventurers, surely it can create an edge in your day to day tasks, right? It's starting to take off, and places like CoffeeShop are early adopters. If you think drinking butter and coconut oil in your coffee sounds strange, you're not alone. I did too. But after trying it once, it's been part of my daily routine ever since. Not just effective in giving your brain some much needed fats, but also delicious. It's similar to a latte, but in my opinion, it's much tastier. 

Of course they have other offerings besides Sherpa Coffee here. They also feature the ubiquitous pour overs, espresso classics, and savory latkes and breakfast pastries. With a friendly staff as well, it's a no-brainer destination to start your day if you reside in the neighborhood.
author: Ruggy J.

description: Dont blink you might miss out on the best coffee in SF.  A few two tops outside. Fast! And dont worry about the fact its smaller than most closets the staff gets it done.
author: Melissa D.

description:
I came here the other day with no expectations just a really good cup of coffee that'll get me up.

I got a sherpa, which was creamy and a hint of coconut and kerrygold butter, it was out of my norm.

I also got iced coffee and cinnamon toast. The ice coffee was a hit, I went in the morning and by the afternoon I was up moving with a long day ahead. 

Definitely getting a iced coffee next time i go. ALSO the barista who made my drink, Bethany was great. She was patient and engaged with me while going through a line of people coming in. 

I never knew about this place, but glad I stumbled upon this place in the mission. I wouldve never guessed but great to know I can grab a well caffeinated cup of coffee that will get you going.
author: Kaycee-zhanel C.

description:
I LITERALLY NEED COFFEE everyday to function so I am constantly looking for new places.  During my quest to try a new coffee shop everyday, I found this place- super low key, super sweet people and good for grab&go (small indoor station)!  Had a Sumatra dark pour over and this potato beef curry thingy that was delish-y.  

The best part about this place is what I witnessed... 2 older ladies came in wanting to learn coffee.. one lady wanted a cup but decided not to buy since it was a little bit out of her budget .. so the barista treated her to a cup since everyone needs coffee in their life.  LOVE supporting a place that supports other people in this crazy world :)
author: HT T.

description: This is the most unpretentious coffee shop in SF with the best coffee. Offering amazing coffee, baked goods and specialty drinks, Wilson goes the extra mile to make sure his products are bar none.  He and his staff are always smiling and friendly and they have created an amazing community out of this tiny space where customers actually interact and get to know one another.  I am blessed to live just a couple blocks away.  I always say to my boyfriend "I want to go to the Coffee Shop."  He asks "Which one?"  I say "THE Coffee Shop--that's what its called."  And how appropriate because it really is THE coffee shop! You don't need any other in your life.
author: Natalie D.

description: Delicious hot and iced coffee, best staff, delicious treats. And they use frozen coffee ice cubes in the cold brew which is a nice touch.
author: Gerald C.

description: AMAZING iced coffee. For real coffee drinkers who love a strong cup of coffee that doesn't mess around. The coffee cubes are a nice touch - good to the last drop!
author: Rachael S.

description: The coffee was brewed very well and each slurp was consistent. Coffee is sure to wake you up and is ice cold with their neat coffee ice cubes.  A must try. Im a bit of a coffee connoisseur.
author: Mitchell P.

description:
We traveled over 30 minutes by bus to check out this coffee shop and we were not disappointed. Worth the time.

The coffee was so good. We ordered a coffee with almond, coconut oil flavor (forgot the name). Wow! So delicious!!

The store itself is small with a couple of outdoor tables. I think one of the best part of our experience is talking to the owner and him describing their coffee making process.

Definitely going back for more
author: William W.

description: coffee ice cubes for iced coffees.... !  thoughtful straws!  gluten free, vegan, locally sourced pastries!?  this man might be more than thoughtful.  i think he's a coffee angel!  All that said, i havent been in a year or so since my schedule changed... but please be kind and pay coffee shop a visit.  :)
author: Cin D.

description:
I am a coffee roaster on the East Coast (Savannah, GA) and I found this gem walking Mission Street.  Hoping to find something other than your typical BucksStar coffee shop.

I walked in and was greeting in this small yet quaint shop and immediately sold on the different choices of coffee I could get here.  Cold Brew with coffee ice cubs as to not water down the taste. Pour-overs made from a custom wooden setup. Delightful snacks and treats that smelled and tasted amazing (try the Latka and all the dressings, it was just as good as the coffee)

Honestly, I can say this is one of the best experiences I have ever had waltzing around San Fran.  I got lucky and did not use an app or directions to find this place.  I followed my nose and stumbled upon this hidden Gem.

Get the hot and cold brew. Double down on some Gluten-free donuts and Potato Latkas, and let the richness of the flavors and great conversation make your day a little brighter.

Good luck and keep the small-town feel of your coffee shop!
author: Eric S.

description: Such a high yelp rating gave me such high hopes for this coffee shop. However, I didn't find such greatness in their coffee. I ordered an iced mocha and there was large chunks of chocolate in my coffee which I was not very fond of. One of the cool things about this coffee place is that the ice cubes are made out of coffee so that the coffee doesn't become watered down when the ice begins to melt. I feel that I should give this place another try.
author: Tina A.

description: The best place to get some high-quality coffee with true love made into it. Little to no wait, friendly service, and just an adorable enviroment.
author: Angelica W.

description: Such friendly service and the best coffee I've ever had. I'll be back again and again! Not a better cup of coffee in da hood!
author: Ottis M.

description:
COFFEE LOVERS PARADISE!

Watch out Wonder Woman, you've got competition.  Your Paradise Island just landed in San Francisco, COFFEE SHOP is coffee paradise!  This "hole-in-the-wall" is very special.  The fact that they serve YERBA MATE (their signature beverage) tells you how special this place is.  Organic Almond Honey, organic Valencia fresh squeeze orange juice... Wow, BAM!!  Homemade bake goods, cookies and chocolates.. double BAM!!

If the World Barista Championship judges were here with me, they would nod their head up and down, and say "YES we agree," and will award my cappuccino, a "Best Cappuccino Challenge!"  Honestly, it has been the best I have had in years! 

You can buy everything here.  Or they will deliver to you for free, in San Francisco that is, on their bikes if you order two or more bags of their organic coffee.  Just go to their website at: https://squareup.com/market/coffeeshop.  However, I suggest picking it up in person and enjoy a beverage or two!!

What a privilege to have met Wilson, the owner and his staff.  They provided me and my BFF a stellar "Ritz Carlton," first class service.

Your initial visit here will give you 50% off any beverage.  It's an awesome deal!!  Don't forget to bring your pooch with you because you can sip and pet all at the same time, seated outdoors!  It's fantastic!!

Cheers! :p
author: Edwin R.

description:
Love that there's so many coffee shops around the area.  After an appointment, went here to get a latte and one of their savory pastry, forgot what it was.  

Latte was really awesome.  Service was also great.  
They have bulletproof coffee and I wanna come back to try.  I raved about it to my husband and I've been meaning to come back.  Soon, very soon!
author: Claire J.

description:
The best experience I've ever had ordering coffee 

Btw they ice your coffee with ice coffee, fuck yeah
author: Joey C.

description: A great find for chai lovers! Their chai has just the right combination of sweetness and spice, and they even have understated chai doughnuts that are a perfect accompaniment. The chocolate chip walnut cookie was delicious too!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Pink Floyd's "Dark Side of the Moon" playing, artwork on the wall by SF artist Amos Goldbaum...it's been two seconds & already this space, not even big enough to hold four customers at the same time, gets my vote. 

Our iced mochas had coffee ice cubes in them, so as not to dilute the rich chocolate/coffee tastes. Our barista -- very cool, very in-the-zone -- topped off our drinks with a messy drizzle of melting chocolate. Awesome on top of awesome. 

Sidenote: My perhaps old school, obsolete way of thinking about dieting wouldn't let me order a Sherpa (aka Bulletproof coffee.) I'm endlessly curious about this concoction of coffee, kerrigold butter, & coconut oil, but I'm not convinced of the health benefits touted all over the internet. Alas, I'm sure I'll give in to my curiosity next time I'm at this cool, little CoffeeShop across the street from Roccapulco.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Just really fun caring people. When I showed interest in their coffee ice cubes he poured me a "sample" which ended up being a free ice coffee. When I told the owner I wanted a hot chocolate he told me about how they need to constantly melt their chocolate as he carefully stirred the chocolate in front of me. 

I was surprised a place could have hundreds of reviews and a 5 star rating but now it makes sense
author: Ben J.

description:
It was easy to understand why this place had 5 stars within a couple of minutes of being here. I came here to try to bulletproof coffee (sherpa coffee) and this place left a really great impression. There was one person behind the counter and she knew everyone who walked in by name. They even have an honor system where you drop off cash if you are in a hurry. We talked about the origins of sherpa coffee and random falafel places around the city as the other people waiting joined in. The point is that the customer service and experience was so incredible and it makes you almost not want to leave (but the place is tiny so you have to). 

Here is what I got: 
Sherpa coffee was great. I had read about it a couple times and this was the only place in SF I could find that had it. It is definitely rich, but not too much. I I would definitely get it again. 

I also got this beef curry knushes that was incredible. They are specially made and have these two sauces that go with them. 

It's too bad this place is all the way on the opposite side of the city. Otherwise I would be here a lot more frequently.
author: Thielson D.

description: With the boyfriend living just around the corner, I really wish I could say that I come here all the time. But the coffee just doesn't justify the price :( one of the priciest green tea lattes I've ever come across at almost $6. Store is also really small and sometimes the wait time is also just not worth it.
author: Lucy Z.

description: Located on Caesar Chavez and Mission my friend and I biked from Daly City on Alemany to get here.  It was worth it. I was a bit surprised that the place was very small but then again its on Mission and its perfect for a small coffee shop. ( Rent be Hella Expensive) The place has really cool interior design. The guys that work their have great personalities. Many locals stop by as they are walking their dog or on the way to work. I got the iced coffee and I gotta say it was A1. The coffee was brewed very well and each slurp was consistent. Coffee is sure to wake you up and is ice cold with their neat coffee ice cubes.  A must try. Im a bit of a coffee connoisseur.
author: Brian C.

description:
It's small place but smells so good and they make everything in deferent way.. I had "Hot Chocolate" at the first time I've been in this place and was so good and light as I like it without too much sweet.. 
They have "Sherpa" I've never had it but the lady makes it in a weird way so will try it next time. 
Thank you
author: Di H.

description: Such a good service. I had iced latte, was so awesome. Coffee tastes great. This place is tiny bit have a great potential of being one of those local coffee shops.
author: Brian T.

description:
Came in town for a week visit. Found this place on my second day and have been back every day since then. The owner is an awesome guy. Coffee is ridiculously good. Just as good as all the other super highly rated places of San Fran. So far this is my favorite coffee joint of San Fran. There is no seating so don't think it's a place to sit and do work. 
**A delivery guy came in while I was there one day and the owner gave the guy a free cup of iced coffee. You don't find people with that type character much anymore.
author: Lee S.

description:
So, after hearing all the hype for so long i finally stopped by the CoffeeShop while out running errands today to get a Sherpa aka Bulletproof Coffee. Apparently it's made with beans from The Ubuntu Coffee Cooperative. 

$5 for a 12 oz. cup. They use grass-fed butter and some coconut oil. It was certainly more palatable than it sounds and I'm wired enough to write about it. When i arrived there was a couple ahead of me who had already ordered ...the wait time was 10+ minutes. Didn't get the sole barista's name but I did receive excellent personalized service from her!

i've been drinking Ph*lz Coffee exclusively since 2007 (primarily Philharmonic or Greater Alarm) and find these flavor profiles much more pleasant that whatever was used in the Sherpa I had...it was a tad dark for my personal taste. Your mileage will may vary and on my next visit I will ask for mine to be made with a lighter roast.

Anyhow, rockstar parking (less than one block away) in a free space on a rainy Sunday afternoon, minimal wait (based on other reviews), stellar service.  

I support small businesses and would visit again if in the area *AND* parking is available!
author: J C.

description: I seriously can say that the customer service is nice and the meals are satisfying. I went here the previous week and tried dreamy iced latte and yes it was scrumptious. Additionally, I would suggest their cinnamon. My visit here was delightful. I definitely will come back here.
author: William D.

description: Every coffee, tea, baked good, and experience at CoffeeShop is made with 100% love and uniqueness. Best tea ever! Better selection than Starbucks. Awesome customer service experience.
author: Eleanor B.

description: Everything is awesome. Coffee, iced kind, latte kind, cookies, tiny space, people... they've nailed it even though a closet.
author: Catherine C.

description:
Five stars for Coffeeshop. Why? Wilson, the owner,  goes the extra mile for his customers including but not limited to

- melting chocolate for mochas
- coffee ice cubes for cold drinks (!)
- juicing organic oranges for OJ
- the Sherpa - blended coffee, organic butter and coconut oil 

Wilson has a giving energy that is really hard to find in your run of the mill coffee shop. He adds value by creating a great coffee experience for people, and his whole attitude makes a difference for the better. 

Coffeeshop is a tiny hole in the wall place but the quality packs a punch! Go!
author: Colleen H.

description:
Awesome coffeshop.

super friendly service and easy to talk to people.  they carry ubuntu beans, which is delicious.  get it hand crafted or specialty lattes/mochas.  They do green tea latte with added espresso shots too! (dirty green latte?)  it was surprising tasty.
if you are ready for the new coffee fad, they have the sherpa, which is coffee with butter! 
very cool that they have an honor system of drip coffee by the entrance.  get a cup of drip coffee and drop in your payment in a box right above it.

they have decent pastries like gluten free/vegan donuts, cookies, latkes, savory pies, etc.
author: Linda T.

description:
Coffee Shop, you are an adorable, unexpected, caffeine-filled oasis, and I'm so glad that Yelp brought us together. 

The girl that made our drinks and buttered cinnamon toast was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, and also made the best dirty matcha latté! My bf got the cold brew and it comes over COFFEE ICE CUBES! Never got watered down - genius. 

We really went a bit out of the way just to come here, but worth it.
author: Brenda H.

description: Look. I really didn't want to have to do this but the coffee I had at the CoffeeShop was probably one of the worst I've ever had. It was bad enough to make me write a review and I've never been bothered to do that before. It wasn't even the fact that the girl was completely new and should of satisfied the owners tastes firsts before even being allowed to serve coffee to customers. It was the fact that the guy behind the counter( I'm assuming the owner) allowed this girl to serve a latte by literally rapidly pouring the warmed milk into a shot of coffee and not even watch her. I could of got a better coffee at McDonald's. I'm sure this is not indicative of the place as a whole but if the owners see this review. Please for the love of god if you are training new staff members make sure they at least know how to make a coffee before you let them serve it to customers expecting a 5 star experience from your place.
author: Kyle M.

description:
The dirty matcha latte has fully blown my mind. My brain is in pieces and it's unclear if they can be put back together, at least without another one of those dirty matchas. Get that.

Really get anything, I tried some of their incredible ice coffee (with coffee cubes of ice!) or even the bulletproof (sherpa?) thing which I can't really get behind but they make it so good I could be a believer.

Wilson's passion for coffee is undeniable and CoffeeShop has leapfrogged Philz/Ritual/Blue Bottle/Verve as my favorite spot in the city. When I'm in the neighborhood it's a mandatory stop now.
author: Misha T.

description: I think this is the only butter-infused coffee shop in the SF area. Coming from LA where bulletproof is all the rage, had to search high and low for this cute little joint. Lucky for me it's close to my job so I'll be back weekly for my fix. The place is super tiny and very easy to miss. But the coffee was delicious.  I didn't get any snacks this time. Will try the array of pastries next visit. But super stoked to have my "bulletproof" coffee in a convenient location. I ordered the Sherpa in large and can literally feel the fat melting off my body ;)
author: Tallestbird R.

description: I adore everything about coffeeshop. It's homey yet togo-like atmosphere. It's personable staff (like, all of them are shining bright and make me feel like a long time friend). The diverse menu that caters to all allergies and coffee connoisseurs. The fact that there is a chalk wall that people can scribble or be really profound on. If they were located walking distance to the ocean - it would be the most ideal space, ever. But the outer mission is fine, too. :-P
author: Bree G.

description:
My body doesn't play well with bulletproof coffee. 

Back when I was heavily addicted to caffeine due to my schedule of having to wake up at 4am in the morning to yell at people to exercise before heading off to work for 12 hours, I would make myself bulletproof coffee every morning with Stumptown coffee from my french press, 1oz of Kerrygold Unsalted Grassfed Butter, and a tbsp of Nutiva Organic Coconut Oil. 

Due to the weird mix of  not enough REM sleep for about a year straight, mixed with the fact that I was always stressed because I found myself always on the go, muddled up on top of it with the adrenaline rush of attending some sort of crisis at any given moment, my body apparently thrived on the hellish combination of caffeine + MCT oils + fat soluble vitamins and eventually started to adapt to the giant energy surge it provided in the mornings.

Sorry for the long, run-on-ish anecdote, but this is where the above becomes somewhat relevant. Fast-forward about six months after I stopped needing to wake up so early in the morning and was no longer plagued by 12+ hour workdays to my current state of not having to do pretty much anything all day. I was back home in California hanging out with my friends, living a life free from the clawing death grip of caffeine as I had absolutely no need to wake up early or maintain some level of lucidity in the morning.

I stumbled into CoffeeShop with a friend after a night of Blackout (it's like beer pong, but with 76 or so cups on each side) and I had discovered after parking at a nearby restaurant where we had our hangover meal that I had a flat tire. After dropping off my car at a nearby mechanic, we decided to walk around to see if there were any cafés and coffee shops nearby, and voila, Yelp had told me that there's a coffee shop called CoffeeShop just half a block away.

As many of the reviews before mine may have indicated already, CoffeeShop is a small, unpretentious, community-centric establishment run by a stand up guy named Wilson. After a brief chat, I was able to discern that Wilson fully embraces the idea of extroverted communities and believes that his CoffeeShop should serve as a place where people come to take a moment and appreciate each other  and the world around them while drinking delicious coffee (the coffee that he roasts/serves on site is very aptly named ubuntu coffee)

Like the other coffee giants that call the Bay Area home, Wilson produces some quality hand-dripped coffee from a variety of well-curated bean choices, while offering up some amazing specialty menus like the dirty matcha latte, the cowgirl coffee, and the iced coffee with the coffee ice cubes.

Now back to my Bulletproof Coffee story. So after about four weeks of not drinking coffee on a daily basis, I ordered a pour-over with the Nicaraguan. A few seconds later, I glanced over to his LCD monitor menu (which seemed to be running a ubuntu-like GUI) and noticed something called the "Sherpa" which Wilson told me was Bulletproof Coffee. Intrigued, I asked Wilson if he could make me a Sherpa using the pour-over I just ordered, and he gladly complied after which he gave me what looks like a Starbucks "grande" size cup filled to the brim with caffeine, MCT oil, and saturated fats. 

I can't quite narrow it down to one cause/suspect, but basically the ungodly matrimony of the above gave me a caffeine high so severe that I skipped the phase where I bounce around everywhere like a hyperactive EDM bopper on MDMA, and went straight to feeling like my mind was trying to escape my body. It was to the point where if I stopped moving or walking for even a single second, my body would become so antsy that I would get the urge to take off in a full-on sprint; my friend and I went to visit some friends that we hadn't seen in a few years while my car was getting fixed after stopping by at Wilson's, and I had an extremely difficult time trying to sit still and listen to my friends tell me what they'd been doing for the past few years (Robe and Alex, if you're by any chance reading this, I apologize for my behavior that day)

Long story short and personal anecdotes aside, yet another quality San Francisco joint that I plan on frequenting the next time I'm back in town. Oh and if I haven't said it already, Wilson is a stand-up guy.
author: Scott S.

description: Best cup of coffee I have had in a while definitely worth the walk in the rain for will be coming back shortly
author: Victor R.

description:
Wilson is one of the coffee genius i consider. His ice coffee cannot be beat (he does take 3 days to make it + uses ice made coffee so the ice doesn't dilute the taste).

I've been coming here almost everyday since I work around the street and I have always been greeted with a smile and a friendly "Hello!"

Wilson uses Ubuntu coffee and the shop is small and cute. Its my go to coffee place in the city.
author: Jean-Marc L.

description:
Coffee is chemistry, and precision yields a great cup. 

I was completely swept off my feet by the cold brew here. The body tasted clean and purposeful, and it is preserved by using ice cubes made from coffee. No dilution here. 

I'm also obsessed with the LED sign displaying the shop's name and the Muni schedule. So cool. 

The owner was extremely warm and took great care of us, and it was obvious that this is a neighborhood joint that cares about the community and the integrity of its beans. Five stars all around. I'll definitely be back to try their other offerings and to stare at the LED sign some more.
author: Olivia V.

description: Best batch coffee in SF, hands down. In addition, their green tea latte is bomb. The owner, Wilson, is very sweet and knowledgeable. Pretty much everything is made in house, including the baked goods!
author: Charlotte H.

description:
Yelp Review

1. Staff Friendliness: 5 
2. Staff Knowledge: 5

(Total score) / (Questions Answered)  = (Yelp!)
author: Charlie A.

description: Coffee made Ice cube is the bomb! I want to drive 40 miles just for that cup of cold fresh brew ice coffee! Even the ice cube melted, it still taste the same
author: Claire C.

description: Awesome coffee. Creative drinks and super yummy homemade oatmeal balls.   Feels neighborly too!
author: Amy B.

description:
Look at Wilson's photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coffeeshop-san-francisco?select=-h4EVLboeScyIQbhvnIkoQ#ABoU3IEt9OAUMGq9uXp5XQ

See it? It's what shows up when angels sing and strum their harps. It is coffee perfection.

We stopped by to try the coffee. It's a tiny space that can fit about six people comfortably, ten snugly, though there's no seating inside (a couple of tables with chairs outside, though). 

I opted for the iced coffee (with coffee ice cubes! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coffeeshop-san-francisco?select=-h4EVLboeScyIQbhvnIkoQ#RjH5nMNtpiY2yD9Pc2zmjw) and a slice of the housemade cinnamon toast (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coffeeshop-san-francisco?select=-h4EVLboeScyIQbhvnIkoQ#HTeV9JJNEQoiUsSDfAzRGA). He bakes the bread, slices off a fat piece, slathers on butter, sprinkles cinnamon and sugar, and toasts it to perfection; it was delicious.

I will always support places like these over Starbucks and Peet's. They're truly neighborhood gems.
author: Adena B.

description:
Adding on to my earlier review: 

I stopped by CoffeeShop again this Sunday morning. My last experience was so positive, I went out of my way to visit. 

Again, my experience was 5 stars. This morning, I had the best cappuccino I've ever had. I have tried all the coffee places in the city, and this drink defined perfection. Also had the toast and peanut butter with honey, which was delicious. 

My final review: CoffeeShop is a "5 star" experience.
author: Marcus L.

description:
Came here since I heard they had really good bulletproof coffee which is that butter in coffee hype. I've never tried it so I decided to go to Coffeeshop and try theirs! I had their Sherpa coffee and it was soooooo good!!! The coffee really reminded of Sherpa! It was so smooth and "fluffy" tasting from the butter or glycerol they put in. Actually it kinda tasted like they put coconut oil or something that had a coconutty/ buttery taste! But the coconut flavor wasn't overpowering instead it enhanced the earthy taste of the coffee! One taste and I was in love! Idk if it was because I've never had bulletproof coffee though, but it was darn good coffee! 

One other thing was that the coffee was kinda filling since they put the coconut/ buttery ingredient in! After drinking half the coffee, I felt like I ate a whole meal!
author: Janet K.

description: This place is extremely unique that u actually get to see the process of making coffee. The lady is very sweet and the coffee is top class. Although there aren't places to sit besides few seats outside, I would still recommend this place for everyone who loves a great cup of coffee. GO AND EXPERIENCE!!!!!
author: Toshio T.

description:
Qaint little hole in the wall (literally--so unlike Starbucks, this is not a house of John Legend's acoustic album with coffee service) in the south end of the mission.

I came here for the bulletproof coffee (called Sherpa probably for copyright reasons). At $5 it's not cheap but it is large and very filling. 

Give this place a try if you're not in the mood for the line at philz (or the dudes with dreds and nose tats plotting a Marxist revolution).
author: Ash S.

description:
A TINY coffee place in the Cesar Chavez area in SF. The inside looks like a "lab" of some sort, with lots of containers and such. From the barista, it sounds like they put a lot of work into make the coffee perfect, such as taking days at a time to brew the iced coffee, by putting the coffee beans in cold water for long periods of time instead of brewing the beans with hot water first and then cooling it down. They also serve almond milk if you traditional milk is not your thang.

In any case, the owners are super friendly, who are clearly into trying things out and experimenting with different coffee brewing methods, so if you're a coffee nut, this would be a good place to stop by.
author: Henry L.

description:
Wilson is the best. Always makes my morning with his cheeriness. Loving life can be contagious, and just as good as coffee for starting off your day on the right foot.

The coffee is excellent as well.

I always grab a Know Nothing - a delicious and healthy (-seeming?) ball-shaped baked good of bananas, oats, coconut, apricots, and yummy spices. My husband and I call them Jon Snowballs..."you know nothing..." eh, eh?

If you're in the neighborhood, check it out.
author: Naomi D.

description: Wow- tiny space big vibe; matcha green tea latte with coconut and homemade bread, organic power balls. Oh yea- coffee.
author: Mark L.

description:
Dropped by for coffee ice cube coffee ! My boyfriend really like it! He got it with soy milk and It is pretty good! Even the ice is melted, it still has strong coffee flavor !!  And I got my flavor matcha latte, it is very good too. I finished it in few mins. 

Service is good, she offered us whole milk, half & half and soy as well! 

You may miss the shop since there is no shop sign at the door or outside, it is on the wall inside the shop, just remember the outside color: all green. 

Overall the coffee are good but they are pricy, $10 for two coffee!  Will drop by again when I am around!
author: Eva C.

description:
Thank goodness for Yelp!

We were in Mission to eat some Mexican, and my friend was dying for some coffee. So I went on trusty old yelp, and saw this coffee shop with an impressive 5 stars. 

AMAZING. The owner is really friendly, lets you take your time, and explains anything you might have a question on. 

He cold brews his coffee for a whooping 36 hours!! The ice cubes he uses are also coffee, so your drink isn't watered down as the ice starts to melt. More coffee shops should do this. Especially if you aren't into chugging down your coffee. 

All my friends got coffee, and one opted for the Yerba Tea. I cannot drink caffeine so late into the afternoon so the owner gave me a free macaroon. Salted Caramel. omg crunchy but still melts in your mouth.

Baked goods- I got the bread he made that was an apple walnut, and it was amazingggggg. 

Honestly, I could go on and on about how amazing this place is, but you should just try it yourself.

If I lived in San Francisco, I'd be a regular here. 

Make sure you check in, you will get half off your first drink!
author: Mina C.

description:
Coffee Shop is an hole in the wall. just 2 tables for sitting. draw is the $1. $2. $3 coffee,. all organic. there's pastry too.

brew: coffee du jour(salvador, 2)
-smooth, robust, satisfying.
-drip or pour over(choice of bean)$3
5 star value for house coffee

drips:
-10ish beans to choose from, all organic?
-friendly service.
author: Victor G.

description:
A very enterprising group of people has taken a small footprint and made it put out big coffee. I mean, this place is tiny. But they have big ideas and good product. 

First, they use Emeryville's Ubuntu Beans. They make cold press coffee and use it for iced coffee WITH FROZEN COFFEE ICE CUBES. I can't even type the level of magnificentness this is. Aside from amazing crafts as baristas, they also just happen to be fun, genuine people with a little crowd of regulars who tickle the daylights out of me. 

And an electronic sign showing you when the next bus arrives (???) because MUNI didn't put one up at the alleged stop nearby (which they later canceled), so, in the spirit of good civic citizenry....

These people are great. Good coffee, good mojo, good baked goods and a good vibe.
author: Steven H.

description:
Simple hole in the wall coffee shop that brews up strong coffee!

The owner recommended Dirty Chai Latte.  I got the Dirty Chai Latte.  With a shot of Ubuntu espresso and with well-spiced up Chai, I was surely awakened.

What makes this coffee shop special, is their coffee ice cubes!  What a clever way of not watering down the iced coffee itself!  Digging the concept.

I went out of my way to visit this coffee shop, that is located all the way out in Outer Mission.  It was worth every step and effort.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Really incredible coffee- if you love coffee you will love this place. Small little coffee shop that really excels in its craft. They also have a good selection of pastries and various drinks: lattes, chai tea, teas, and iced coffee. 

What I got: The Peru
-Bold, smooth, and rich
-Mosaic roast

With a touch of milk and a dab of honey, my coffee tastes absolutely perfect. Next time I'll be getting some of their coffee beans as well, but definitely stop by here if you're in the area. Service is always welcoming and they have an honor-system for coffee if you don't wish to wait.
author: Veronica L.

description:
really wonderful little place. at least when I came there was just one nice woman behind the counter pleasantly and charmingly serving very delicious beverages (at least my iced coffee was) in a small but tidy little shop. I was second in line at ~10a. not sure what this place would be like if it were busy. but it sure is nice here. 

I'm sitting outside the cafe at a little table on a beautiful morning while I'm writing this. very much recommend.
author: Mark E.

description:
Very impressed with everything. 

The owner/barista is funny personable and knows his coffee very well. What a great find!
author: Daniel N.

description: Small coffee shop on Mission. I was searching for gluten free options and to my surprise this little coffee shop had 4+ options to choose from. The owner was there working hard and eagerly ready to greet everyone with a bright and happy smile which made the vibe in the shop relaxing.  Next thing I knew I spent 30 mins talking about life!  Entrepreneurship at it's finest! Great coffee too.
author: Jeron D.

description: This small coffeeshop makes the best original slow drip coffee. The barista provided us with free beverages and small pastry with out purchase of the their roasted coffee. This was an unexpected offer from the shop owner.  The Sherpa coffee was a smooth blend with coconut oil. Wow I did not expect it to taste that smooth.  I will definitely come back here whenever I am back in San Francisco.
author: Jason W.

description:
Waited until a few stops in to make a judgement as I consider myself a freak about coffee. These people do it right.

Yes, the cold press iced coffee is expensive. Yes, it is worth it. Did I mention they make the ice cubes with left over coffee? Why is this never done anywhere else? 

They use Ubuntu beans, which are roasted over in Emeryville and some of the most underrated beans in the Bay. 

Staff here has always been super friendly and not snobby hipster. I have never found that in a coffee shop of this quality. 

Although I haven't gotten any, all of the treats look fantastic and fresh. 

This place is unfortunately less than a block from my work. All of my money will be gone soon. 

Next time I feel like I'm going to go for the owner described "hipster iced tea" - Yerba Mate, lime, ginger and honey on ice. ?!
author: Anthony G.

description:
BEST coffee experience EVER. Go here. Come from a far to visit Wilson he knows his coffee. Truly amazing he is the Jiro of coffee. 
Everything Wilson does is to a science, and his work shows his passion for the product.
author: Steph W.

description:
What a place!! Food is good and I can't wait to go back there for the same experience 
Coffee is amazing and the atmosphere is nice.
author: Benji L.

description:
Awesome coffee, Ubuntu beans are great and the staff know how to handle them, both hot and cold. 

Pastries are nice too, not the ordinary, but variety is lacking.
author: Ran H.

description:
Oh CoffeeShop. How I miss you. I used to help my friend Taylor out at his soda shop The Fizzary down the street and would often stop in for an iced coffee because it was simply the most delicious iced beverage I knew of. Those ice cubes! But now I live in the United Arab Emirates and there just isn't anything comparable. 

Oh, to be in the Mission again. To have Wilson hand me a cold glass of happiness. Enjoy it if you can, San Franciscians. And pour a little out for me.

*sigh*
author: Cassie D.

description:
I moved away from the neighborhood 2 weeks ago, and I have serious Coffeeshop withdrawal symptoms. I will have to start scheduling return trips to say hi to the amazing folks (Wilson, Olga and the whole crew) that make heart-poured coffee! 

PS: The Sherpa is SPLENDID!
author: Ajesh S.

description: Every weekend I walk 20 minutes just to come here. The coffee is superb, but owners Wilson and Olga are the reason I go out of my way. This is the anti-Blue Bottle. No one's going to boss you around or "educate" you about the "right" way to drink this or that drink. Order what you like and you'll get it, probably with a high five. Also: coffee ice cubes. These people are brilliant.
author: L. A.

description: Love the conversation of community. Great coffee. Great service. Its a small powerful space
author: James L.

description: Blown away. Excellent coffee. Fun and different. Significantly over priced though, even for SF, and that's saying something, BUT when I got my drink, I forgot all about the price, so worth it.
author: Julia M.

description:
A closet sized coffee shop can pack a lot of charm and that's what Coffeeshop does. The interior has a chalkboard wall, wood accents and a modern look. Treats from Desperation and Batch Bakery include cookies, muffins, and brownies (they need some additional breakfast pastries). 

Yes, they offer free wi-fi (I brought my laptop) but there isn't any indoor seating, there isn't even much room to stand inside...but they do have two small tables outside. It's a friendly place that unfortunately lacks space to linger.

* Latte ($3.50): very nice foam art, strong and smooth but could be creamier, hoped for a bit more complexity in the flavor
* Spinach quiche: Not a large slice but a yummy one filled with lots of spinach and cheesy flavor too, a bit of egg, thin crust
author: Lolia S.

description: Wilson and his coffee are the best in the world!  My girls and I just happened to find this incredible store and I was blown away by the quality of the coffee and the love and connection I made with Wilson!  The pastries are Old world flavor and made with great ingredients!  Bring a gemstone to leave on the counter when you go in and walk out with a new one!   I love that!
author: H L.

description: Love this place. It's a bit pricey but always great service and really good coffee. I go here as often as I can
author: Kelly H.

description:
I know a lot about coffee; I travel the world for my business and fortunate enough to try amazing espressos in different cities 
When I moved to bernal close to this coffee shop, I had little expectations....after all it's a small place called "the coffee shop"
Today I can safely say and defend that this is the best espresso I have worldwide.  Yes sounds too much, but the owner Wilson pours his heart into it, uses all organic ingredients, and serves a consistently wow espresso 

Note: If you try the first time, there is sometimes a bit of difference depending who is the barista;  best is to try when Wilson is there and he is there most mornings
author: Nick T.

description: WORTH EVERY PENNY. The coffee is great, and the baristas are super sweet. I love their iced coffee, its like the drink that never stops giving, once your finished your latte, you have an iced coffee waiting for you at the bottom of your cup.
author: Liz F.

description:
Thank you, Yelp! I was headed towards Ritual but wanted something in the area and found CoffeeShop. I was impressed with their selection and Wilson's keen eye for design as well as his passion for coffee.

The ice cubes were even frozen with coffee- thank you thank you! I hated diluted iced coffee D:

Perfection in a cup, I'll be back! Oh yah..they have a plethora of baked goodies, all baked nearby :)
author: Veronica S.

description:
This is one of the best things that could happened to this neighborhood. The people that work here are the sweetest and awesome! 
They aways make my day happy. 

I love their korean ginger tea, in fact I've started to become an addict to it. It's the perfect combination of honey, ginger and lemon.
Their pastries and snacks are very good too, especially the lakes, with sour cream and homemade apple sauce.
I also appreciate that they have the times for the next muni (14,49 and 33). 

If you are in the hood craving for some coffee, tea or a good chitchat, this is the place to go!
author: Arael D.

description: Don't get the toast - they loaded it with butter, but it's still incredibly dry. The coffee is fairly inconsistent, but the sherpa is an interesting novelty.
author: Amin S.

description: We love the coffee, amazing taste and very friendly workers. It's a nice grab and go place
author: Saima M.

description:
Just got back from coming here for my first time and it is a great little coffee shop.  It is just the essentials inside but they do provide some seating outside if you would like to hang out.

The young lady who made the coffee was very friend and asked how my day was going and there was a good atmosphere inside with the other customers in the shop.  They have a ton of different coffee options from drip to latte to espresso and even the rare bullet proof coffee a paleo staple.

In addition to this great coffee selection they sell whole bean bags of coffee for $15 (12oz) but you get a free cup of coffee with that if you purchase them together which was a pleasant surprise.

Their baked goods looked great as well and it was very hard to not order a slice of toast but was satisfied with just the great cup of coffee.
author: Matt H.

description:
Just happened to Yelp a place for coffee and to my delight, found this little place!

I was surprised that it was a one-woman shop. Small, or should I say quaint. Moreover, since I have never been there before, it was honestly hard to find if you're walking on the other side of the street. The signs small, but if you know that the place is painted all green, it'll most definitely catch your eye!
