Small selection of pastries but all looking very tasty! I couldn't help but buy the chai flavored pastries. ALSO, THEY HAVE MACARONS! I did not feel like macarons at the time, but if you were wondering, they cost $1.75 each.

The owner was very delightful, and made each coffee and tea with care. I really liked that. I've been too use to the rush and busy feeling you get at regular coffee shops (Starbucks etc.). The little store made me just want to take a moment and just enjoy my latte. Also, my Matcha latte was light, and not at all bitter.

Next time I come back to the Mission district, I'll definitely come by again!
author: Julie N.

description: Seriously, one of the cutest, friendliest coffee shops I've stumbled upon. I was lured by their Sherpa coffee and great reviews - and this tiny, adorable place won my heart. Poem was so warm (she remembered my name!) and generous (we were gifted a nice sample of their Rooibos iced tea...yum!), making our drive clear across town well worth the trip. If you love *good* coffee, healthy eats and exceptional service, you're in for a treat.
author: Nichola d.

description: Coffee was good. But I was expecting a little more to be honest. The coffee shop was run down. There were bugs in the pastry case. Dogs were in there eating their treats. I am not from the area. But maybe that is all typical for where this shop is located. I'll stick to blue bottle!
author: Chris B.

description: Wilson is awesome. His iced coffee with coffee ice cubes is so very good. My wife and I love the cinnamon toast. Wilson is a true genius squeezing so much goodness out of 200 square feet seems impossible, but he does it every day.
author: Gary C.

description:
Love this place. People working there are so nice and the coffee is freaking GOOD. Quality. 
1 star off because there is no seating,
Other than that, delicious little foods like magical balls, latkas, and other random things. 
The barista was such a homie, no idea what her name was but half shaved hair and super friendly-- thanks for the best cup of coffee!!
author: Dede C.

description: Look for the green building - easy to miss but a total find. The sherpa (bulletproof) coffee was worth the stop. Friendly staff, worth a visit when in SF.
author: K B.

description:
This place is so popular there is often a line out the door of this tiny shop. My boyfriend loves the coffee here, and I love the Matcha lattes with almond milk. Sometimes we have to resist the urge to go because the drinks are on the expensive end. But I usually give myself a once a week treat from here. 
There are some yummy gluten free snacks too! 
And local honey.
author: Addie S.

description:
Love this place.  I started coming here when I moved to the neighborhood about 15 months ago.  I've always had great coffee and snacks here.  Wilson and Olga are great and they have really become an integral part of the neighborhood.  Sometimes when I'm jogging Bernal Hill I see Wilson out front and we automatically high five.  It's like a scene from a corny 80s movie.

Aside from Wilson and Olga they have several other staff members who are wonderful, make great coffee and are fun to chat with.

Overall this place is total win; I feel fortunate to live so close.
author: Eric C.

description: Fantastic coffee, awesome service! What more needs to be said, really...? This place is a gem of a cool free spot, if your in the hood- check it out!!!
author: D F.

description: Came on yelp in need of a nice coffee and picked this place. I recommend for you to try the Sherpa! It is a coffee with coconut oil and had a nice sweet taste to the coffee. I tried the "world's best ice coffee" and didn't find it as incredible. The coffee was a bit to strong for my liking, but I liked that the ice cubes were made of coffee! The place is tiny with only a few seats outside to sit at, but if you are in the neighborhood and need a coffee fix, stop by.
author: Nikita K.

description:
I'm a huge espresso afficionado. I have tried all the best coffee shops in San Francisco but this hole-in-the-wall hiden gem beats them all.
The owner and barista Wilson is probably the best barista. The sumatra beans, all organic product and pastries are just out of this world.

Ned
author: Anonymous X.

description:
Great great service, however their coffee just isnt for me. This place feels like a hipster's paradise. They use Ubuntu coop beans, and the people working/hanging out around there are all very friendly. However, their coffee is very strong/robust. Idk, maybe it's for hardcore coffee connoisseurs, but I do like my coffee to be smooth and naturally sweet. The coffee was pretty bitter and very strong (n caffeine too, I could definitely feel the rush half a cup in). I did like their iced coffee, but flavor-wise, I wish it was easier to drink.

If you want a medium/dark roast cup of coffee that is strong, and good service, definitely a place worth trying out, the owner definitely works hard for his customers with coffee ice cubes and coconut oil/butter sherpas.
author: Mikayla L.

description: Awesome roasted beans (from the Ubuntu coffee cooperative), lovely family run shop with many delicious snacks (currently toast, vegan donuts, latkes, and knish!)
author: Tasha D.

description: delicious coffee, delicious homemade pastries and snacks and toasts. chill vibes!
author: Belle P.

description:
Wilson, Olga, and the entire staff are awesome, and most importantly, their coffee is top-notch. We recently moved our office near here, and it's become everyone's favorite coffee shop.

We keep a bottle of cold brew in the fridge, and stop by every now and then for amazing pour-overs. Oh, try the Sherpa - I usually take my coffee black, but thoroughly enjoyed it.

Will come by more frequently when they start accepting Bitcoin!
author: Andrew L.

description:
The guy who owns and operates this place (I think his name is Wilson) is great and everything we got was delicious. I had a latte and gf /dairy free sweet orange bread, and my husband got freshly squeezed orange juice (the owner literally squeezed it right before our eyes) and pumpkin bread, also gf/df. 

Everyone who came in while we were there knew the owner, so I think he has a good following. But if you don't know what you're looking for you might miss this place. So keep an eye out for this hidden gem and make a new friend.
author: Brittany M.

description: I have never written a review before, but this place is definitely worth the time. Great customer service. Matcha latte with soy milk was amazing. I am now a matcha fan...but really only from this place. My boyfriend got the Sherpa coffee and also really amazing. Try it out...you won't regret it.
author: Ysabel U.

description: Potato pancakes and Sherpa is all you need. They also make a chocolate chai off the menu.
author: Regina L.

description: I love this neighborhood coffee shop. They have a huge variety of high quality coffee and tea and THE BEST dirty chai in town.  They also serve butter coffee, which is a MUST in the morning (if you haven't heard of it, Google it). And an amazingly refreshing yerba mate iced tea when your adrenals have had enough caffeine.
author: Jessica A.

description: The pedestrian coffee drinks such as an Americano are fantastic but the Sherpa is amazing.  It was frothy, yummy goodness filled with nutrients + caffeine-perfect combo.  The folks working there were so friendly that I would go back even if the coffee was mediocre but thankfully both the coffee and people are worth it.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Nice addition to the neighborhood--for, ahem, the "gentrifier" type who probably hasn't lived in Bernal long enough to know this kind of place was sorely missing. Should hit it for the commuters to and from 24th St. BART. 

Coffee and pastries are solid. The pour-over was very good; the soy latte was rocket fuel. I had the shakes; it tasted like 4-5 shots. Lots of flavor and lots of fuel.

Friendly service.

Another one of THOSE places with $4 toast. Srsly.

On principle I can't be a regular, but I'll drop in now and then for the pour-over or latte and know I'm getting quality.
author: Stephanie P.

description: I work down the street from this coffee shop, and I pretty much purchase at least one item from here every single day.  Faves:  Almond matchas, dirty chais, and black iced coffee served with coffee ice cubes.  Food-wise, their potato latkes and knishes are great snacks for those on the go.  Excellent service, and strong, robust flavors in every beverage.
author: Monica O.

description: This place is amazing in that it seems really understated and every time I am impressed how awesome of experience I have.  Wilson and co. are super nice, and the coffee is really good.  The one thing that blows me out of the water every time is is the Peanut Butter and Honey toast.  Seriously, it is worth driving across the city for.  It does take a bit of time to put together, but great things comes to those who wait.
author: Maxwell S.

description: Very nice owner. Made some fresh decaf for me, and I wanted it iced so he did this cool method to ice the hot coffee. Tiny cute little shop. I would come again if I'm in then neighborhood. Very tasty.
author: Mariam A.

description:
What a bunch of sweeties that run this place!

And they'll make you an excellent drip. Cold brew? A+ I dunno about espresso but I'll just say that it's amazing to keep in line with the rest of this review.

Toast here could be better but the weird spice breads they have from time to time are really delicious.
author: Michael G.

description: I just love this place, the vibe, the owner who is so happy to be there and makes everything with love! Bulletproof is insane as is regular coffee drinks.
author: Lynn R.

description: Amazing coffee, and the friendliest staff you've ever met. Immediately makes you feel like family.
author: Jonathan O.

description: Perfect latte and a pastrami knish to boot! Loved this small shop. They care about coffee here. Mahalo!
author: Laura K.

description:
There are two different types of coffee shops. The ones where the baristas take pride and the Starbucks type places where they just whip something up and send you out. 

I ordered a simple espresso and the barista made the heck out of it. Fantastic. I'm coming back!
author: Sean B.

description:
CoffeeShop is like buying coffee from your neighbor. Next door in his studio apartment. Yeah, he's super nice and he's way into coffee - it's good coffee. I prefer to go to coffee shops, however, where I can sit down and relax with my wife. Maybe do some people watching and get on some wi-fi, and hopefully admire an espresso machine I'll always want in my house and never be able to justify. Your neighbor doesn't offer all that, and neither does CoffeeShop.

All the positive comments about the friendly staff are spot-on. Seriously, super nice.

I wasn't a fan of the cold-brew, even though the ice cubes were frozen coffee. I've experimented with that myself, and I don't think the taste is as pure. It was also served to me in a paper cup. I prefer glass or plastic for cold drinks, as I assumed everyone did. 

It's a neat little place worth visiting, but it's not five-stars.
author: Marcus C.

description:
Cool small spot.  With wifi.  Fresh micro batch pastries.   Ubuntu coffee.

Looks like they need more for this to be a review. But do you really want a long missive  when you just want coffee?
author: Brad R.

description: Great coffee place! Really friendly people and great coffee. They even serve free coffee for homeless! That's amazing!!!!
author: Vincent V.

description: There was a good vibe from this shop and they accommodated my family with a warm welcome.  The pour overs were great and the treats were perfect to start the day.
author: Anthony E.

description:
I don't like giving this place two stars. The person working the counter was very friendly. Based on other reviews, I believe this to be Wilson. I also love the idea of coffee ice cubes in a cold brew.

However, he can't make a latte. My wife and I on our last morning in San Francisco were deciding between trying this new place we hadn't tried or sticking with Blue Bottle for our last latte of our trip. We decided to go with CoffeeShop because it was closer, we like trying new places and all the great reviews. I'm writing this review because I don't want people to make the same mistake we did.

He looked like he had a good pour over set up and I'd love to try the cold brew, but if you are looking for an espresso drink avoid this place.
author: James L.

description:
Great espresso. Chocaletetey(, a bit of cranberry, Smooth a little acidic. The dude did me a solid. At least I resolved the espresso craving...energy to find my wallet!

1st stop on my coffee/espresso tour.
author: Stella N.

description:
The ice coffee is legit. Aged, cold brewed, served over coffee ice cubes. Super mellow but still strong. 

How have I missed this place for almost 3 years? I just met Wilson and his daughter this week when he moved to our small block by Precita Park. Today I just happened to spot him at CoffeeShop on my way to Baby Blues. Glad we looked in today and paid a visit. Coffee kismet! Im always happy to support a friend and neighbor in the community. Especially when they serve great coffee.
author: Zac H.

description: was getting my car detailed at mr ecowash and needed a quick caffeine fix. found coffee shop in walking distance and enjoyed a delicious mocha.  the latkes looked amazing, as did the rest of the pastries. later realized i was in walking distance of mission pie, but still had no regrets. woot!
author: Archana P.

description: I really like their concept and philosophy. Tiny hole in the wall with homemade sweets and organic coffee. However my vanilla latte was just meh. Nothing special, nor bad nor good really. Good neighborhood stop, I wouldn't go out of my way for it though.
author: Maryne G.

description: Best Cold Brew Coffee I have ever had! Great staff! Definitely stop by if your in the area!!
author: John J.

description: If I could give 6 stars I would! Wilson is amazing. His ingredients are top notch and his nature is so sweet, fun and kind. I traveled all the way across town to get out of the Marina and to experience his Sherpa (special version of bulletproof style coffee drink) and it was the best I've ever had. So creamy AND made my work flow extra focused. I loved seeing him engage with the diverse array of customers who came in during my stay there. Highly recommend the Sherpa and The potato latkes...and I imagine almost anything you get will be delicious and made with love.
author: Jess J.

description: Wilson knows his coffee.  Love the coffee ice cubes steeped 2 days.
author: Sandra M.

description:
Ethiopian brew was so good; not bitter at all.  The know nothing snack was delicious and service was friendly. You also get 1/2 off your drink order if you check into yelp for the first time.

It's small (there's only two tables and a few chairs outside) so might be better for carry out.
author: Xteethx B.

description: Amazing. We had an Americano and an Iced Americano. Both were outstanding. I LOVE hole in the wall places and this place is perfect. All of my senses were satisfied. Highly recommend!
author: Rachael C.

description:
OMG!  You MUST stop by and have a coffee and chat with Mr. Wilson Jones!  He is absolutely FANTASTIC!!!  He makes fresh cold brewed coffee with delicious filtered water as well as cold brewed coffee ICE CUBES, so your cold brew/iced espresso drink does not get watered down!  He also has lots of tasty snacks and drinks available, like his super delicious clove infused apple walnut bread, muffins, freshly squeezed orange juice, awesome espresso drinks, and also offers almond milk for those who prefer non dairy alternatives!  Yipppppeeeeee!!!!!

Support a great local coffee shop and get the best coffee and conversation in town at the same time!  :-D

I absolutely LOVE this place!!!
author: V. W.

description: Good god, this place is amazing. Matcha lattes, tons of cardamom in the chai, hemp-coconut-vegan know-nothings...
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Olga was my barista. She is hospitable, friendly, and great conversation while I wait for my drip coffee to complete it's mission.

Thank you coffee shop for your down to earth vibe in an often poshe neighborhood ;)
author: Marlena Z.

description: My partner and I just love this Coffeeshop! Great service, great pastries, and of course great coffee.  If I have a stressful day or whatever and need a boost me up I just stop by here and I am all smiles again:D.
author: Kevin K.

description: One of the best cups of espresso coffee one can enjoy! Yay!
author: Prodromos P.

description:
Really cute little shop. The staff was friendly and knows their coffee - I asked for the most acidic thing they had, and they had a good recommendation. The coffees are dark and delicious if you're into dark roasts.
There are just a few pastries BUT they're all excellent-looking. I had a Mignon Macaron that was delicious.

Bonus points for signs in Helvetica.
author: Mitchell F.

description: I don't understand how any body could give this place less then 5 stars! This place is exceptional in every way! I make coffee for a living and this guys coffee was probably one of the best coffees I've ever had. The service, absolute second to none super friendly, laid back awesome bloke. Definitely returning when I come back to SF
author: Dayle J.

description:
A coffee shop named CoffeeShop. Fitting for the city. It's a quaint little place, serving some of the most delicious iced coffee I've tasted in a while. They cold brew it and serve it with coffee iced cubes - that's how you know they care. They also serve latkas, it's like a hash brown pastry stuffed with egg and some salt and pepper. So simple, so good. 

They also have an "honor system express bar", so you can come in, pour yourself a great cup of coffee, drop the money in the box and be on your merry way. I think it's a great example of trust, something that we need more of in every community.
author: charlyn g.

description: Cool teeny spot with amazing coffee and a supernice owner.
author: Andrew K.

description: So sweet and delicious! Iced coffee uses coffee iced cubes so it is not watered down, YAY! Staff is super friendly, like walking into someone's personal kitchen. Wide variety of baked goods-gluten free options too. Even homemade fresh baked daily choices also. But the best part...wait for it....the bulletproof coffee!!! Aka butter coffee :) Fun fact: if you're running late they have an honor system box with to-go cups and fresh coffee right by the door. Just make it yourself and drop some cash. Beautiful business...tiny-just wish they had indoor seating, but at least they have tables outside! Love it.
author: Kyria E.

description:
Oh this discovery all to Yelp.  The owner is super friendly and really passionate.  The Citrus Yerba Mate Latte was amazing.  Heard that the specialty is the iced coffee (where he freezes the ice cubes from the coffee so that it doesn't become diluted ... ingenious!  Will have to try it next time).

Finally, the owner gave me a PB&J Macaron on the house that so frickin good.
author: F. P.

description: Great coffee, great pastry. I went here twice and I'm excited to come bcak.
author: Jonah E.

description:
What's not to like??  FANTASTIC , flavorful, rich and smooth coffee ..quality hard to beat!  Small, cozy, CLEAN, and well appointed.

Very friendly folks who know how to serve QUALITY at fair prices without any of the pretense you find at hipster cafes.

My new favorite spot for QUALITY coffee without the snobbery or attitude.

Great job!
author: Sara D.

description: Quick and friendly service, eco  friendlier option for ice coffee cup-100% compostable, delicious knishes and coffee ice cubes for the ice coffee....nuf said
author: Miri R.

description:
What a fantastic coffee experience!  Great service, really nice owner and the coffee is amazing. The decaf espresso was freshly ground and Wilson made an outstanding iced Americano which was not at all watered down. The macaroons are top of class.

The shop is small but extremely well decorated.  I am so happy to have stopped by!
author: Terry P.

description:
Where to begin?
Really amazing coffee for great prices without the pretentious horse s@#t.
I walked into this tiny, albeit, bad azz spot by chance because my friend wanted a cookie. 
The owner was gracious, friendly and approachable - five stars for service alone!
And the iced coffee... poured over coffee ice cubes!
Hats frikkin off!!
author: William T.

description:
1. Ubuntu coffee
2. Option for a pour over right in front of your face, or serve yourself and drop two bucks in a jar
3. Friendly, wonderful baristas. The first time I came in, I received an explanation for each brew, like a wine tasting.
4. Brewed with filtered water-- a very good thing!
5. You will often hear The Smiths playing, loudly
6. Vegan baked goods
7. Restroom and a couple outdoor tables to sit at while waiting for the 49/14 bus.

Really a top spot in my opinion.
author: Cour B.

description: Coffee cubes! Best coffee spot! Coming back every morning.  They specialize in the ice drinks!
author: Rand O.

description:
This place is heaven to me. I just started working across the street, and MAN, did I not know what I was missing in the world of coffee until I came here! 

This stuff is DELICIOUS. The only problem is that I now miss this place on weekends :( I am ruined for all others forever!

The owner is super awesome and friendly, and I love their self-serve honor system for coffee.
author: Jessica K.

description:
They keep it simple at 'CoffeeShop', no need for a fancy name- keep it simple and churn out a wonderful cup of coffee accompanied by delicious treats (many vegan) is the perfect business model in my mind and CoffeeShop has mastered it! 

What this coffee shop lacks in size it more than makes up for in deliciousness. I highly recommend one of their amazing brownies with whatever beverage you decide one.. a brownie goes with everything!

Free wifi but like I said the joint is small and lacks seating. But a perfect spot for your on-the-go coffee and munchie pit stops.
author: Elaine M.

description:
The Best Little Coffee House in the West

The Willy Wanka of Coffee has arrived to San Francisco, and he's set up his magical coffee factory at 3139 Mission St.  His name is Wilson, and he serves up the best cup of single-pour coffee, espresso, and macchiato west of the San Francisco Bay.  Why is he the best?  Put simply, because he puts love into every coffee pour, and he makes the customer feel warm and happy with his affable and kindhearted nature.  If you want iced coffee, ask him to show you his stash of frozen coffee-based ice cubes, which he uses to make the iced coffee extra tasty and strong.  If you want a green tea latte, it's delectable! Order a Yerba Matte and he'll give you the whole gourde and bombilla set to enjoy.  

Not only has Wilson done his homework about coffee prep, he excitedly shares amazing facts about the cutting edge technology and artful techniques, which he applies to every pour.  Wilson is an artist when he works, and he's damn good at his craft.  

But here's what makes The Coffee Shop truly outstanding: it's the way Wilson treats his costumers from the moment they enter the shop until the moment they leave: with intention, compassion, and care.  I love getting my coffee from Wilson because I get such a wonderful social experience with the coolest, hippest, and talented barista-owner-operator-human being in San Francisco.  So go brighten your day and get caffeinated at The Coffee Shop - serving the best coffee in town.
author: Allen K.

description: Fantastic coffee! Coffee ice cubes, vegan gluten free if you're down for that. Amazing owner. The spot to be! Thank you!!!
author: Carly S.

description: Literally a hole in the wall coffee shop across from the El Rio bar and Employment office here in the Mission / Bernal area. Speedy high energy crew that can accommodate your special coffee or espresso drink requests. You'll walk right past if if you're not looking for coffee.
author: Silicon W.

description: An eye catching hipster hole in a wall in the Mission District. It was my first time here and I ordered a Dirty Chai Latte for $2.50 with my first check-in (50% off your first beverage). This place is quite expensive without the discount, but I will still stop by again next time because it was AMAZINN! Can't wait to try their iced coffee with iced coffee cubes during my next visit:) Sounds cool huh?!! What a great, cheap invention to prevent watered down coffee!
author: Debby L.

description: It was fantastic.  Try the sherpa and the cacao chia balls.  Wonderful coffee and breakfast and service by Wilson. A must stop!
author: Mary J.

description:
Super friendly and knowledgeable.  They do wonders with their iced coffee - steeping their coffee for 2-3 days to provide an even taste, and adding coffee ice cubes to maintain the flavor when the ice is added!  
Highly recommend them!
author: Heidy S.

description: Only place I've ever found that serves bulletproof coffee.  The owner, spot, & coffee are all epic.
author: Luke N.

description: Tried cold brewed and Sherpa on my last two days in SF. Two best cups of coffee I have ever tried. No kidding. The cold brewed is neither bitter nor sour, I could have it straight up black and enjoy the ever lasting flavor thanks to the coffee ice cubes. Sherpa is perfect if you like hot coffee, butter and coconut aroma. Amazingly balanced. I have never praised a coffee shop with 5 stars, but this coffeeshop nailed it.
author: Tim O.

description:
A boutique.
Lots if variety, uncompromising quality and great service are making this place the best coffee experience you'll have in SF.
author: Yuri M.

description:
Single pour coffee only a 5-minute walk from our house!  HOO-RAY!  

Mocha made with TCHO chocolates. Ubuntu brand Sumatra coffee beans. Live music by Hipsteria every Sunday. Vegan Know Nothings and Espresso cupcakes. This place rocks.

It's a tiny little place with excellent coffee.
author: Rachel D.

description:
No menu. No store sign. No prices. A bit intimidating. Also, I was kind of shocked at the price for a large iced coffee: $5. But it was the best iced coffee I've ever had. Worth it.

EDIT: I've been going here for a few months now. All the coffee I've had here has been superb. The owner is a neighborhood treasure.
author: David W.

description: This is one of the best plqces ive been to. It was pretty decent in the sense thatbis lets you chill and talk. Liked the ambience. Arre waah mazzza aa gaya
author: Ashish G.

description: The owner was lovely and the coffee was delicious!! You can tell they put a lot of care into every cup. Yum!
author: Katie F.

description:
CoffeShop has the best coffee in the city! Their iced coffee is brewed for over 24 hours and has a full-bodied, rich taste. As an avid coffee lover who has tried dozens of coffee shops in the city, I finally found the perfect cup.  They offer coffee ice cubes for their iced drinks that are the best caffeine-infused invention besides coffee itself. The result is a creamy yet strong cup of coffee.
Despite their tiny space, they have cute picnic tables on the sidewalk that are excellent for a work-day coffee date. They offer coffee from Guatemala, Nicaragua, Colombia and more. Their lattes and teas are just as delicious, and the baristas are always ready to cater to your every whim!
author: Nicole S.

description: Checked out this hole in the wall coffee shop only to find a gem! Wilson is an awesome guy who serves great coffee! I highly recommend the Sherpa and his Iced coffee (it takes 3 days to prep..now that's dedication!) will definitely come back for the coffee and this great individual.
author: Dom O.

description: Amazing. Simply amazing. This place left me buzzing, and it wasn't just my delicious almond milk latte! First of all, this place would have been impossible to find without Yelp - the shop is TINY, and there is no name on the green banner outside the store. I would say the shop is probably 10 feet across? Somehow though, this all adds to the charm. The owner was lovely, and made us 4 drinks for half price because we had checked in on Yelp. All the drinks are made in front of you, one at a time. He walked us through what he was doing, talked about his iced coffee ice cubes (marinated for 2 days before freezing!), and had no problem changing my boyfriend's mom's order when she decided she wanted a different drink (thankfully, prior to him making her drink...). Honestly, do yourself a favor and check out this San Francisco gem. You won't regret it, and you won't forget it!
author: Maddy L.

description: You cant go wrong here. Great atmosphere when i'm getting my coffee every morning. Pastries are good but would be great with more variety. Those ubuntu beans are tasty!
author: Jeff A.

description:
Awesome place!!! WOW! Awesome customer service, Wilson was super nice to us. I went with my friend, and it was our first time here. I wanted some coffee because I was craving a latte, and it helps me go number two. My friend found this place while he was waiting for me outside of Walgreens, and we decided to check it out. When we got there, and my friend mentioned the Yelp reviews, and all, he gave us some homemade tea that his wife had made to try. I ordered a large latte, and my friend got an iced coffee, and a chocolate chip cookie. Because it was our first time there, he actually decided to give us half off! I was like WOW, and he was super nice and friendly. I could feel that he had a passion for what he was doing, and that their business was run out of love. I was also told that everything is organic and as real as they can get, which is also very important to me ever since I've changed my diet to organics and paleo for health reasons. My friend and I sat outside and enjoyed our coffee and cookie while we had a nice conversation.
I'd definitely recommend this place to everyone!
author: Sam T.

description: Coming from Oklahoma, it was a nice change of pace. Very welcoming staff and excellent beverages/pastries. I recommend the iced coffee with the coffee ice cubes. The red head barista was helpful with tips around San Fransisco.
author: Charissa J.

description: Great people - and the most amazing cold brewed ice coffee + ice coffee cubes in the city.   Go here!
author: ankur v.

description: Super cute shop, friendly staff, and delicious coffee. I came in to try the sherpa and was not disappointed, been hearing about the butter coffee thing for a while and decided it was the time to try it. This was the only place I found that had reviews about it and it wasn't too far from my work. The sherpa is a big ol' cup of coffee and they use a lot of butter! It tasted pretty amazing and was super creamy. I expected it to separate pretty quickly, but it didn't. I would probably go a little light on the butter next time so that my guilt doesn't cloud my enjoyment of this tasty cup of coffee. I would definitely recommend it.
author: Amy S.

description: The coffee is excellent. Wilson's awesome. The shop is minimal recycled modern. Get the soy cap.
author: Jacob M.

description: I work in Twin Peaks, but will make a special trip to enjoy a great cup of drip coffee or Hot Ginger Tea at Wilsons. The pastries are made by a local baker and are also fantastic!
author: Luis M.

description: It can be hard to stand out in a city with an expansive coffee culture but Wilson and crew does so in a real way. Favorite coffee shop for sure. Frozen iced coffee as ice cubes is over the top in the best way.
author: Travis C.

description: Amazing, friendly, delicious, home made treats, fine ingredients, great service, just, 5 stars all around. No argument here. Almond matcha is delicious! Oh and their vegan know nothing's.
author: Mickaela R.

description:
Brand New Coffee Shop called COFFEE SHOP!!!  How cute is that?!!  

Had a Matcha Green Tea Latte w/almond milk, which tasted great and hit the spot!  Most places don't have Matcha, nor almond milk.  SCORE!  Also, had the coconut walnut Bundt cake made by Batch Bakery and it was super moist and delicious!  

Outstanding Customer Service w/a nice selection of Ubuntu Coffee, other caffeinated products, and baked goods.  I'll definitely be back and stay longer when they get tables, chairs, and wifi! :)
author: Caitlyn C.

description:
Great hole in the wall coffee spot. Super friendly service and great coffee. Yes it's a little bit of a wait, but that's because the product is great!  Had the Sherpa this morning. Mmmm. Only suggestion I'd make is offering coconut sugar for the Sherpa. Lots of Sherpa drinking folks won't do regular sugar or even Agave, so coconut sugar would be the go to. 

Also had a Paleo friendly little chocolate ball treat made by the owners. Delicious!

Thanks.
author: J K.

description: excellent coffee. one of the best places in the area coffee wise, and atmosphere wise
author: Vi P.

description: I'm new to this spot, but the Sherpa is outstanding, it's my new thing, and the atmosphere is super friendly.  Recommended!
author: Dylan C.

description:
Such a great grind and the attention to details makes this my new spot!
Very nice baked goods as well.
author: Bunkie I.

description: This place has amaaaazing, healthy, well-roasted coffee. Do yourself a favor and stop here for some good quality coffee. Wilson is the man!
author: J. C. B.

description: Really enjoyed the iced mocha I had here yesterday. It is a small place and there are a couple of tables to sit at outside of the shop. The owner was super sweet and its great to see her make the coffee in front of you. She used real melted chocolate and I watched her grind the coffee. She even gave us a free "treat." Definitely recommend this place!
author: Sarah K.

description: Raw honey and really good cookies! Had the Matcha iced latte.. YUMMYYYYYYY!!! Their Korean Ginger tea is delicious! This place is going into my favorites!
author: Rosa G.

description: Incredibly friendly and welcoming service PLUS iced coffee with coffee ice cubes?! What's not to like about this place! Although the store is a tad small (make sure you know where exactly this place is because I completely walked by it without even noticing it...it's that small), it still has a cozy and aesthetically pleasing interior. The owners and workers here really know what they're doing and truly care about their products and their customers. It's places like this, with spot on customer service and wonderful coffee, that remind me of why I'd always support local, neighborhood coffee shops rather than large chain ones.
author: Aaron W.

description: This little coffee shop is itty bitty but so thoughtfully put together in all aspects. Very obviously run by someone who takes the time to step into his customer's shoes and understand the little things that take a cup of coffee to another level. Like iced coffee comes with coffee ice cubes so it doesn't dilute the coffee. Great place and great coffee!
author: Ge O.

description: Thank you providing Gluten Free pastries and health conscious goodies.... Not to mention a friendly atmosphere and good coffee. Cheers
author: Carl C.

description:
Wilson makes some delicious cold-brewed iced coffee and yerba mate drinks. There are an assortment of yummy, locally sourced pastries and they serve up Ubuntu Coffee. The shop is super cute and convenient when your finishing up a hike coming down from Bernal Heights.  I recommend you check this place out!

I actually enjoyed this place so much I wrote up an interview about its owner. Check it out here:

http://missionhipsters.com/2013/05/15/sf-people-interviews-wilson-jones/
author: Kevin C.

description: Awesome little place. Has cute like tables outside. Smallest coffee shop ever only 3 people can fit insider but good coffee. Had the americano.
author: Vanessa O.

description:
Been going since they opened and need to write this since we're leaving town (not that this place needs another 5 stars, but it just seems like if THIS place doesn't get my 5 stars then who will???). 

I used to be a chai fan before I went to CoffeeShop. Then Wilson, the owner, hooked me on matcha lattes, which are delicious. He would make one for me and a mini for my toddler, which made getting caffeine on the weekends much easier since I could get my kid to come with me. Then I graduated to a dirty matcha (with a shot of espresso--definitely an acquired taste). 

I finally tried the drip coffee and there's pretty much no going back. At last, a cup of coffee that tastes SOOOO GOOD! Made a coffee believer out of me. It's good to be able to get a $1 or $2 cup of coffee out of the airpot, but the drip really does taste better. I recommend you save yourself a few bucks (yes, this place can be a bit pricey--you're paying for the quality and the small business experience) and buy a bag of the Ubuntu beans for your house. Tastes great on my french press. 

If he has any fresh baked goods (baked that day) from Batch then by all means get them! Doesn't matter what they are. Just do it. 

I probably frequent there 6 times a week and will miss it when we move...
author: Todd B.

description: Best coffee shop in San Francisco. I partially don't want to write this review bc I don't want people to overrun this place, but everything they do here is fantastic. Their iced coffee here is the best I've ever had in my life - I don't even mind that it's $5 because it's that good. I'd rather pay $5 than drink shitty watered down iced coffee (looking at you Ritual). Not a spot for getting work done, but it's a cute and cozy coffee shop that serves up the good stuff. Enjoy.
author: Keith P.

description:
Love this new coffee shop. Serving Ubuntu coffee, Dare I say better than my two current faves? (Blue Bottle and Philz)

Nice shop, nice people, great coffee on the go!
author: Bea C.

description: You really can't get a better cup of coffee anywhere. Not just because the coffee itself is excellent (as it is in many establishments on the west coast), but the atmosphere of this little shop is really worth the trip to the middle of Mission St. Whomever serves you will know anything you need to know about coffee and a whole lot more. Everything is made with care and thus is tasted as such. Cinnamon sugar toast should be ordered with any drink you get -- excellent morning accompaniment.
author: Joe A.

description: Stopped here for the first time this morning. Very friendly woman making the pour-over/espresso drinks. She was very helpful in helping me decide on what coffee to try. I ended up getting a pour-over of Mexico Chiapas. Very good flavor, a bit mellower than I'm used to but still very good. They also had fresh latkes and knishes just in time for Passover.
author: Kevin D.

description: Hole in the wall-place with amazing coffee. Bonus points for the coffee ice-cubes instead of regular.
author: Lennard C.

description: Coffee is really good.. For me it's on par with the nicer places sightglass / 4 barrel etc. I was happy to see a good selection of gluten free offerings.. Mostly doughnuts and cakes, nothing savory. The main drawback for me was that the only seating was outside on mission near Cesar Chavez. So, although there is wifi, it's not a spot I feel comfortable hanging out with my $$ laptop..
author: Cat M.

description: Hole in the wall in the outer mission but has solid espresso drinks made with ubuntu beans. I loved the latte and the americano and surely will be back!
author: Beril Y.

description: Cute little hole in the wall that's surprisingly sophisticated. The barista (who I assume is also the owner) was super sweet and attentive. I was the most impressed by the coffee ice cubes, which up to that point, have only existed in my dreams. I'm taking away one star due to the lack of seating.
author: Christina E.

description: When I first walked in, i thought awww how cute is this little shop is!! The Decor is absolutely cute! I'm so glad they finally have a spot that has coffeeshop, because i had yet to try!
author: Dana R.

description:
Welcome to a land (a small land/space) where everything is more.....much more than it appears.  Everything from the whimsical irregular wooden slats adorning the walls, thoughtful sayings/quotes scattered about, to the "heart in the drop of water" logo, reflects careful attention to detail which synergistically adds up to much greater than the sum of its parts.  In this small space you will find some of the finest coffee prepared with perfection, organic juicery, and some of the best organic baked goods.  

You will not find a proprietor who takes more care than Wilson (co-owner with his better half, i.e. wife) nor find someone that derives more satisfaction in the caring for his customers.  They have a genuine interest in ensuring the best ingredients are used in everything, from the coffee, fresh squeezed juices, and baked goods, all of which are unparalleled.  When you consider the love that goes into everything they do, this is truly genuine. Only a new dad (congratulations!!) understands the need to be sure everything is as clean, pure and wholesome as it can be.  They haven't earned the highest Yelp rating record because of customer throughput.  You get the picture.  Seriously, from his family to yours.
author: Jerome B.

description: Imagine a Samurai going through a daily tea ritual except it's your espresso or whatever you have. That's Wilson. But if you're in a hurry you can just tell him to hurry up.
author: Brian S.

description: Peanut butter and honey toast on thick piece of fresh baked bread, and custom breewed gourmet coffee, all served in an almost tea ceremony way. As close to Zen as a stimulant purveyor can get!
author: Cotter K.

description:
The coffee and the goodies were indeed a heavenly combo... I loved every moment of being here, it isn't just about the brew, it is actually about the entire experience. 

The staff was courteous, the ambience was cosy, the wi fi too was good....the evening was undoubtedly perfect... I surely will look forward to coming back here...

Thanks
author: Deborah G.

description: Legit Coffee. Say what : My iced coffee was 80%Sumatra and 20%Ethiopian beans aged in the fridge over some iced coffee ice cubes and almond milk ! I am a very happy gal. Thank you for coming to my neighborhood , I will be back !!! And Wilson...you freakin rock! Thank you for your outstanding service!
author: Lia N.

description: No frills good coffee and solid, good customer service....my friend and I had never visited this small establishment and it was initially difficult to find as they didn't have any visible sign. Once we did encounter the green painted front, we were happily greeted by a tall gentleman standing just outside the counter who seemed to also worked alongside the friendly barista, Bethany. He may have been a regular or he may be the owner, but nevertheless, he made the visit inviting. Bethany informed us about the organic coffee's origination and the amount of butter and coconut oil she added in our Sherpas. Neither my friend nor I have ever had the creamy, rich java and had been curious to try it, thus leading our search for this little coffeehouse. We could've made it ourselves but having an experienced maker concoct it delighted us. I usually drink my coffee black; the Sherpa (or Bulletproof, as I've heard it called) would be a treat I'd be willing to have again in the future. It was surprisingly light and absolutely satisfying! When I visit the City again, I hope to return for this.
author: Wella A.

description: I love Ubuntu coffee and too few stores carry it. In Oakland I can buy it at Farmer Joe's or in Emeryville at the roasting source. In SF I have found it at Rainbow. Most often though, I pick it up when I'm on Mission St. I always enjoy taking to Wilson at the cafe and when I go to Emeryville, to Rich, who started this wonderful co-op, Good stuff!
author: Susan G.

description: The Mocha was amazing. Probably one of the best in SF region. Be advised, this small hidden place is addictive.
author: Sudeep G.

description:
The most caring cup of coffee you'll receive in the city. Though, that's more of a prediction of what would happen if I drank coffee; I ordered yerba mate with ginger and lime! Similar effects of care were evident.

The set up of the store is sweet. When you get there, step inside and simply pivot in place for 360 degrees. This place was built for you to enjoy. Now order your (vegan) pastry and walk out to make room for the next customer!

Robert rocks!
author: Justin P.

description: I hardly take the time to write reviews, but this place is Amazing! First time here and the owner is the nicest man ever!
author: Jewdee J.

description: AWESOME!!  Cold brew with coffee ice cubes. Blew my mind. Dude is amazing. Best coffee I've ever had. Wilson is the best
author: Scotty B.

description: My boyfriend, dog, and I stumbled upon this place while in the area, and I'm so happy we did. The owner was quite possibly the nicest person I've ever met, and made an amazing soy latte and mocha. He even gave my dog a treat with our coffee. If I lived closer, I'd become a regular here.
author: Caitlin A.

description: Fantastic coffee, delightful atmosphere, didn't believe the reviews but this is a five star place.
author: Alex C.

description: I'll add to its pile of five star reviews.  Adorable little place, and my friends who got the coffees with me all said they made amazingly well done coffee-beverages.  They have a wide range of sweet and savory pastries and edible wonderful things -- I was expecting slim pickings, and was shocked how good everything we tried was.
author: Zachary R.

description: This was our first stop on our vacation from Southern CA last week. Olga was the barista, made a great pour over. She provided the best service we had on our week stay!
author: Finley C.

description:
some of the best coffee you will find, made by awesome people. go here.

(and if its hot out, make sure to get the special coffee ice cubes)
author: dan h.

description: Latkes for the win! Wanted something that wasn't a baked good for breakfast and I got it here. Delicious, flavorful, filling. Tried the Sherpa coffee and it's pretty amazing, y'all. Try out this shop if you're in SF!
author: Allie T.

description: Awesome place. Just a couple tables outside, no seating inside. Really great coffee drinks. Excellently nerdy homebrew LED-strip-based bus prediction sign built into their wall.
author: Joe G.

description: The iced coffee with the coffee ice cubes was brilliant. Cubes melt, more coffee :) The service though is what will keep me coming back. Wilson and his wife are such a lovely pair and it was a pleasure to speak with them. Left with some homemade banana apple walnut bread that brought a smile to my face with every bite. Excellent hole in the wall and well worth the visit.
author: Chloe R.

description: Green tea matcha w/ almond Milk & a dollop of Korean honey is my morning fix. It's so smooth & addicting that I will drive out of my way to get it. I only wished they'd serve granola w/ fruit or an egg sandwich & I'd be in breakfast heaven. But their baked goods are pretty damn good--mascarpone brownie & Zuni cookies are yummy. Love supporting a local biz w/ nice folks. Oh & the bearista are not shy about letting you drink out of their own cup to try something new, now that's trust.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Delicious coffee - super friendly owner - even gave me a free delicious banana bread to try :)
author: Elana R.

description: Incredible latte, best I've had in the city. I didn't try the coffee, but you have a choice of 5-6 Ubuntu beans used to make a slow drip. The barista was careful and thoughtful, clearly there for the coffee and your enjoyment. The shop is super chill as well. Great vibe all around, except it's not the type of place you can sit at and work (there are no tables).
author: Mary V.

description: If I could I would give it no stars. I called the store to make sure if it was open today on a Sunday and it was 5pm even though yelp said it was open. (Sometimes yelp isn't accurate with the store hours) I called twice until a guy answered and said yes they are open till 6pm! Drove all the way from Daly City and when I got to the store the lights were off and door was closed! Wth!! What a fucking waste of gas! Called the number back but this time no one answered!!!!!!
author: Vanna D.

description: Exeptional customer service, exceptional coffee! Thank you so much for making my day! Happy camper!
author: Robert H.

description: Wilson brews a goddamn good cup of coffee.  the iced coffee is good, the espresso drinks are good, and he's been known to have an impromptu dance party whilst introducing people to new music.  aces.
author: Kris C.

description: The beans (Umbunto) are great. The product is excellent. They have the best iced coffee in SF. This place is a hidden gem.
author: Robert T.

description: Love this little "Coffee Shop"! I go there pretty much every day for my late "morning" coffee. It seems to be the spot the neighborhood has chosen and it is because of Wilson's awesomeness! He treats everyone like a rockstar and is always interested and interesting. I recommend the ice coffee...he/they make coffee ice cubes for the ice coffee!
author: Paul d.

description: Wilson is just an amazingly passionate dude, who took over a little space and turned it into a special place to get a really good cup of coffee. His iced coffee with iced coffee cubes packs a punch, and is an absolute must on a warm San Francisco day! The espresso has evolved into being as rich and flavorful as any!
author: Zachary T.

description: Great pour coffee, delicious blueberry muffin, friendly service.
author: Kate D.

description: This place lives up to its five stars.  Super friendly staff that make you feel like a regular your first time in.  The coffee and baked goods are amazing.  I recommend the banana nut and cinnamon toast bread...yummm!
author: Ryan L.

description: Like others have said, just know the color, GREEN!  The sign is inside, along with the best coffee experience I have had...ever. This one man show (hopefully just for the moment) is a true passionate connoisseur of life, coffee, and people.  A no frills (no heavy syrupy drinks), unique, and "90%" organic place, and if you just love good tasting coffee, Chai, or Matte then this is your place.  Get the 'Sherpa' if you want a incredibly smooth, creamy, strong tasting coffee of unique ingredients that will leave a wonderful taste in your mind for days after!
author: Grant B.

description: Both the drip and the cold brew are some of the best I've ever had. The owner seems to be very proud of his cold brew and gave me a decently-sized free sample, (correctly) assuming that if I tried it I would ask for a regular serving. The ice cubes are made of coffee so you can enjoy your iced coffee without worrying about it getting diluted. I've only tried one of the donuts - maple pecan - but it was very good as well - very moist and just sweet enough. The staff are friendly and will explain anything you want to know about the coffee or beans. I will definitely come back the next time I'm in the area.
author: Jeff H.

description: Excellent coffee, great conversation. Happy to be welcomed in to sample an unfamiliar coffee brand and learn something new about the neighborhood and community. Wilson was remarkably kind and genuinely invested in his family-owned business. Cheers to great iced coffee!
author: Jill H.

description: If you like coffee, you will LOVE this place.  I am kind of a coffee snob and I have my favorite places to get them.  This place is #1.  The coffee is always soooo good. I even buy ground coffee from there when I'm going to have people over for company.  He also has yummy treats from all local, neighborhood vendors. Super awesome.  It is a little pricey, but it's a super treat!
author: LuLu M.

description: I love everything about Coffee Shop. Delicious Ubuntu coffee, the friendliest owner ever, amazing locally made baked goods, and a cozy and welcoming atmosphere. As a resident of the neighborhood this is such a welcome addition to Mission street. Expensive? Sure, but so is most good coffee in this city. I'd go here over Blue Bottle or Ritual any day. No snarky attitude and just a lovely experience that always sets a great tone for my day. The owner, Wilson, cares about the community and we need more local businesses like this one. Go and support what he has brought to the hood! And definitely try some of the baked goods.
author: Christina L.

description:
Wonderful Coffee and delicious pastry. 
very friendly service.
I will be coming back.
author: David H.

description: this is a walk up coffee place with only outdoor seating.  but my $2 self serve black coffee was really delicious and not bitter or nasty.  in fact, i wanted a refill but had already far exceeded my caffeine quota for the day.
author: Lillian M.

description: All the reviews here are spot on - this place is awesome! And the owner Wilson is even more so. Stumbled upon CoffeeShop when we were in the area and searching yelp for coffee, and so glad we found this place. Iced coffee was one of the best I've had, and their gluten free oats & fruit ball was delicious. Cool little neighborhood gem.
author: Donnie W.

description: I have never written a review before, but in this case I felt compelled. This is the best coffee place I've ever been to, including: two -thirds of Europe, anywhere in the U.S. (having been to 33 states) and South America.  The staff made me feel right at home with their smiles and warm conversation.  This is the only coffee place in San Francisco and I would emphatically say you should visit, especially if you are already in the Mission District!  (But really, no matter where you are, you should go.)
author: Sean S.

description: Top-notch coffee, top-notch treats, entirely down to earth owner. I always add sugar and milk to coffee to cut the bitterness and/or acidity, but the beans and prep are so good, I drink it black. The treats are local, fresh and baked to perfection. I now look for errands to run in the mission just to have an excuse to stop in.
author: Kirsten S.

description: The experience of the CoffeeShop was fantastic. The barista, Jane, was friendly and prepared my iced latte right on time. When you're in a rush, the best coffee shops have great reliability & value and CoffeeShop falls right into that category.
author: Juan H.

description: Really delightful coffee shop, owner is passionate about coffee and his customers. Gem. Find. Awesome.
author: steve m.

description: Hey people! As a long time lover of all things coffee i felt i needed to give a review to a great coffee spot in the mission called coffee shop! its on 3139 mission street and they have a great thing going! Using Ubuntu Beans you can get your cup made singly or get a quick cup to go with a really cool and unique honor paying system for the later. The owners clearly love what they do and the passion shows not just in the great coffee but in the Locally made baked goods also. I highly recommend coffee shop and urge everyone who loves coffee in SF to give them a try. You wont be disappointed!
author: kevin m.

description: Charming shop, great owner quirky and fun menu. Dirty matcha is great.
author: Hee S.

description: this place is a great sf find, a fun little place with great quality stuff. had an incredible hot chocolate!
author: steve r.

description: Friendliest coffee shop ever!  They share my excitement for coffee and we just chatted away about the origins and flavors!  Great pull, froth, and pour.  They even gave me a sample iced coffee.  Delish!
author: Jo C.

description: Awesome little coffee spot.  Wilson is super friendly, and knowledgeable about coffee, graphic design, reclaimed wood and living in the Outer Sunset among other topics.  Support a chill local business and give this place a whirl.
author: Michael S.

description: Stopped in to this mysterious signless coffee shop and met the very cool and friendly owner Wilson.  The space is small, but beautifully and cleanly designed.  They hand brew Ubuntu coffee from Emeryville and stock their displays with really delicious looking Russian pastries.  I'm so glad this great coffee shop opened walking distance from my place.  :)  Will definitely be back!
author: beverly l.

description: Coffee making as a spiritual practice.  the owner is finding his zen in making the perfect cup of coffee.  coffee with COFFEE ICECUBES so that the melting ice add's MORE COFFEE!  genius!
author: Adam G.

description: This is a great little business! I had a iced Yerba Matte and the guy told me about what exactly it was since I didn't actually know. I also had a yummy gluten free coconut baked treat. Chatted with the guy and girl that were working and they were very cool and interesting. The also have some great chalk art including a mandala on the door to the bathroom.
author: Marni S.

description: Coffee Shop is now my favorite coffee shop of all time!  I am not much of a coffee drinker nowadays due to my caffeine sensitivity but this place has changed my mind for good.  I get the Peru decaf and it is out of this world!  It has a nice mellow flavor (like all coffee should be even decaf)  and slight floral and yet smooth mouth feel.  The owner is quite a character and  is very passionate about his craft.  If you ever are in the neighborhood drop by for a cup of coffee and great conversation.  Coffee Shop, you guys rock!!
author: Ling W.

description:
Snuggled away on the business of mission st. lies coffee shop_. It's small but bigger is not better if you're looking for delicious baked goods, pour overs, and featuring roasts from ubuntu roasters (yes there are other quality roasters besides four barrel, ritual, & blue bottle).
Local cofficianado and resident pour over sadhu Wilson is great, offering a small selection of quality treats you'll need to keep your day moving, and all with sincere peaceful vibes. 
I would pop in more if I lived in the city and manage to make it there every time I am in town. If you find yourself in the outer mission go there!!
author: bok k.

description: Small cozy spot to get amazing coffee, The matcha latte is to die for. Free Wifi great beats, what else can you ask for.
author: Eva R.

description: Coffeeshop was a friendly but small cafe.  I had ordered an iced coffee and it was good (with almond milk and even coffee ice cubes to not water the drink down). They had a few vegan pastries which I liked and the employee was very friendly. Would go again :)
author: Emma D.

description: Barista was super friendly and made a pretty good latte - easily the best I've had in the area.
author: David M.

description: Nice owner. $5 iced coffee. When we ordered 2 iced coffees we should've known by the lack of menu and price list we were going to be gouged.  When he said, "$5" I thought that was pricey for 2 medium iced coffees.  When he said "each" I was in too much shock to argue. $10 for iced coffee?  Beer is cheaper. Not returning.
author: M M.

description: a real neighborhood gem with great coffee and service. 'nuff said.
author: CJ C.

description: What can I say, this place is great wonderful pour over coffee, iced coffee to die for and fantastic espresso drink, small, cute, local, organic products, excellent selection of baked goods, Wilson the owner is friendly and nice with zero javatude, he is actually having a blast making that coffee which is great.
author: S I.

description: Place is awesome totally loved the honor system.
author: Ryan G.

description: My 25 year old son and I found ourselves on Mission and decided to check out this small treasure of a coffee shop.  My son is more the aficionado than I when it comes to all things coffee and swears that this was absolutely the best cup of iced coffee he's ever tasted.  The coffee is cold brewed and served over coffee ice cubes so it never becomes diluted.  His coffee had a slight almost fruity quality to it that was just delicious with absolutely no bitter aftertaste.  Mine was freshly brewed decaf and was more "coffee tasting" than any decaf I've ever had - again, no bitterness and somehow also a perfect intensity with no dilution as one would expect with freshly brewed and iced coffee.  The taste was the closest I've ever had to coffee in Italy.  In addition, the pastries were fabulous - especially the banana apple walnut cake, made with incredibly fresh ingredients and a recipe that the owner, Wilson, has been perfecting for many months (redolent with cinnamon and a bit of nutmeg and the most wonderful hint of salt) - stop fiddling Wilson, it's perfect!  The place itself is cozy, tiny, and reflective of Wilson, the owner - completely welcoming and unpretentious, and just, well, a place you want to go back to again and again.  Coffee is locally sourced from a roaster in Emeryville.  It made our day to visit, meet Wilson and take our time enjoying his fabulous coffee. I've no doubt we'll be back again and again.
author: Amy C.

description: cool little coffee shop in the mission with great bake goods!
author: Lisa H.

description: Fantastic, no-attitude coffee place - great beans (Ubuntu) make perfect pour-overs, and the owner's anti - pretentious wisecracks are so welcome in the midst of this foodie era. Only two tables out front so mostly a take-away place, but great if you're on the go.
author: tw s.

description: I love the coffee shop! I come for the Batch cookies, colorful company, and amazing macaroons. The iced yerba mate is my drink of choice on a hot summer day, and the warm version is perfect in the winter. Wilson is the man, and this place has only gotten better in the past year that I've been going!
author: Maureen S.

description: They have the best ice mocha in Mission area. Wilson, the owner, pre-make the coffee as coffee cube which make my ice mocha taste still the same even the cube melted.
author: Wing N.

description: Hell to the yes. This guy is super friendly, not overdone or fake though. Small tiny lil hole in da wall, yet is serves up a fantastic cup of joe. Iced coffee is da bomb! He makes a mean latte and I will be back to try more. Finally a place with an owner who gives a shite about customers and good coffee. Rock on!
author: Mel S.

description: owner Wilson is great, and conscientious about providing the best coffee drinks and snacks, all sourced from local artisans.
author: jml j.

description: This place is awesome. The coffee's are great and the baked goodies are excellent. Try the "know nothings" and the banana nut bread. The staff are what keep me going there as they are very friendly and knowledgeable. I wish I could give more stars
author: Jaime V.

description: Coffee Ice Cubes?!?! YES! GENIUS! Never again will my lattes or iced coffees water down.  Soy Lattes are delicious and the peanut butter chocolate chip cookie is amazing.  Service was awesome and this place is now our dedicated coffee spot. Whippee!
author: Candace D.

description: The coffee is delicious. The baked goods (made locally) are delicious. The owners and employees clearly love their business, and it shows!
author: Christine C.
